description:
We never ever let any Restauranteur or their Staff know who we are we critic them for good or bad. With 20,0000 food last mile deliveries we know when a restaurant has our taste buds in an uproar La Fonda Restaurant on Irving Street In the City is Worthy of Great Mention.
I had been DeliverIng all day and wanted to eat really good home cooking food and I send one of my assistants to find me a home cooking style restaurant and the ones that I like to eat from where 45 and one 2 hours away. I was not so sure of the food. When I tasted the Taco de Carnitas.
WOW MY TASTEBUDS HAD FABULOUS  TIME SAVOURING THIS DELICIOUS TACO AND IT BROUGHT ME BACK HOME TO GREMAS COOKING .
author: Yisel D.

description:
I've come here a few times! It is the first time that at any Damn Taqueria that they "share" chips!
I PAID SEPARATELY WHY IN THE WORLD WOULD I SHARE CHIPS WITH THE OTHER PERSON. They paid and ordered separately?!? INSANE!!
Cashier and cook were rude as fuck about it!!!
And they gave the other person "dirty ice" didn't even want to give a cup with us like other places they give it to you without an issue!!!
HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!
author: Susanyelli Z.

description:
I will give it two stars because the Salas bar was good.
The meat was so tough it was like leather.   
The older lady taking the order was rude.  
Keep walking if you end up out front of this place.
author: Lance S.

description:
The staff are polite and the place is very relaxed and casual, the menu is average and the food is average as well. They offer chicken, steak, BBQ pork, shrimp, and vegetarian options. The main issue was that the meat came out dry both for my BBQ pork, my cousin's chicken, and her husband's steak. 
The price here is average at about 8-10$ a dish and the food being average quality comes out about even.
author: Anthony S.

description: The Burrito here was mediocre at best. It was definitely a nice size for the cost, but the flavor was lacking and it just Didn't taste fresh. I just stopped in really quickly after I finish the work out because I was starving however I was greatly disappointed.
author: Ty S.

description: I feel I owe this place a review, seeing as I come here so frequently. What makes them so reliable, is there are a variety of dishes I like to order: veggie burrito, chicken quesadilla, super taco, panuchos and more. They have a self serve salsa bar, the green salsa being my favorite. They are consistent too, every once and a while they miss the mark, however, I never hold it against them.
author: Heather S.

description: Love this place. Order ahead of time. Love service and they are always suppper sweet.
author: Ivan M.

description: The woman taking orders was SO rude. She was acting like I was crazy for ordering one of the burritos without rice. Then, she asked if I'd like mild or spicy and when I said spicy she looked doubtful. My boyfriend, who is clearly Hispanic ordered spicy also. When our food arrived I was surprised that the hot sauce on mine was sweet, so I tried his, which was actually spicy... this is incredibly demeaning and totally rude!
author: Kailey W.

description: Good place but waste of time... if your listing says open at 10,,,, don't open at 10:30!
author: George C.

description: They're food is mediocre, by all means overpriced, and the staff are rude as fuck. They look at you like they literally hold deep contempt for you for being there. I don't know what they're problem is. They gave me shit for taking too much complimentary salsa after I spent my money there several times. They can burn in hell forever. Thanks.
author: Andrew L.

description:
I ordered a super burrito with al pastor as my meat choice, I was surprised at the price as the burrito should be 7.75 but came out to 9$
When I look at the receipt they had a surcharge for al pastor... it was only .50, but it shouldn't be there at all, the menu says al pastor is one of my meat choices, not one of my meat choices but with a hidden add on fee. 

I wonder how many other things have their secret add ons and how many of us are over paying in small increments.
author: Greg F.

description: Went here around 9:30pm. Ordered the Azteca Burrito, which was alright. Took a long time for the food to come out. Meat was a bit tough, but I really liked the salsa bar. We asked an employee if she could refill the water jug because the water ran out, but she never did. All the tables were also dirty with dishes.
author: Amy T.

description:
Not once they did their orders right, every time I order jalapeños with my meals to go.  NONE WHATSOEVER!  Even when I tip them for my take outs, you only tip when you dine in.  

Either they have some kind of language barrier, or they only listen with the big tipper! 

If you must go, you better check your orders before you leave.
author: DAVID T.

description: Gave this two stars for the green salsa, everything else deserves a one star rating. The meat is flavorless, chewy and fatty. It's like they choose the worst meat to cook and drop it into burritos. I've tried this place 4 times hoping I would find something that I would like. I really gave this spot a chance since it would be nice to have an awesome Mexican food spot in the neighborhood but this place disappointed me every time. Underdogs tacos and burritos are a million times better than this place... This place is in a prime location it's unfortunate that it has terrible food.
author: Steven C.

description:
This place has the world smallest burritos in California!
They should start weighing out there meat because it's not Worth the money they charge! That's the last time I go get a burrito from this place!!!!!
author: E M.

description: Authentic Mexican, clean, always super friendly staff. My go-to spot for a breakfast burrito, and they never cap breakfast time!
author: Jessica R.

description: Rudest front end folks I have seen in some time. First of all, I asked for brown rice. The cashier looked at me as if I was from another planet. She thought about what I asked for a moment, and responded with a disgusted face, as if I asked for poison. Then, instead of taking the order, she opened the cashier and started doing accounting with another colleague, all the while I stood there blabbing off what I wanted in my bowl. She dismissing may looked to another woman and said, can you help him, which she started counting another fistful of cash.. Then the other woman began with an indifferent face and continued with the service massacre.. Couldn't take it anymore... Left, when another customer just jumped in front started talking to all of them in Spanish.. Wasn't sure what he was saying, but he sounded pissed off.. Either ways, won't be checking out this joint any time soon...
author: Bayabil G.

description:
I used to like this place, would occasionally stroll in and get huevos rancheros. Yesterday I asked for them over medium and the lady cook slapped them on the grill. In 2 seconds, the dish was ready. The eggs were raw, the white part was completely swirling around.

When I went up to ask her to redo them she gave me a dirty look and said "you wanted over medium", she didn't even look at them to see what was going on...Then she rolled her eyes.

When I said thank you to her for redoing them when they were ready, she ignored me. They were cooked so well I couldn't eat them. It was as though she did on purpose to be passive aggressive. At this point I gave up, had my beer and ate the chips. 

The women who work there are rude, unprofessional, and act like they work in a brothel, belching music at the top of their lungs. I really wish the cook didn't take the request so personally, it wasn't my fault the eggs were uncooked.  

Also, the place was much dirtier than I remember. I almost slipped twice when I got up. :(

Don't go there, there are so many other places around 9th, save the Mexican for one of the many, many good places in SF.
author: Larissa M.

description: Food is good. The people who work there seem to have an attitude and somewhat of bad manners. Music is always too loud and the tables are always dirty with plates
author: Carol G.

description:
La Fonda provided a great Mexican food options at affordable costs like a big size quesadilla for $6.50.  I was in a time crunch and near the Inner sunset, and thought that A few tacos would suffice. Instead looking over the menu I chose the Al Pastor quesadilla that comes with guacamole and sour cream.

The restaurant has a few tables downstairs and about 5 tables upstairs, and they have good tomatillo salsa as well as a solid chipotle salsa at the bar.  The decor is simple, but I like the orange cream colored walls as it reminds me of a traditional color for churches and government buildings in small towns in Mexico.  So aside from the childhood memories, this place does make tasty Al Pastor.  They also give you a generous amount of chips for free with your meal.

The food is 3.5/4 and the prices are totally 5 star for food in SF
author: Marlon T.

description: Chicken taco was oily and the carne asada in the carne asada taco seemed spoiled - would not recommend this place.
author: Praveen S.

description: Worst Mexican in SF. Tortilla was hard, meat had chunks of grease, tomatoes in salsa where old and chips were stale. This place is disgusting!
author: Hannah C.

description: I'm not Mexican so I can not how close it is to the real thing but I had an Al Pastor (BBQ pork) burrito and it was great. Will have to try the other stuff. BU so far so good.... Cheap too
author: Leung T.

description: The meat was dry and lacking in seasoning. The rice was decent. The chips tasted like they came out of a bag. The flan was probably the most disappointing. It was firm and stuck to the fork. Flan should be custardy and creamy. If you're short on time then this would do but if you have other options I would advise you to go to a different place.
author: Isabel T.

description: This place had apathetic customer service, and food that was extremely disappointing. On top of that, there were dirty trays and dishes everywhere. When I went to grab a fork, I picked up three before I found one without a dry piece of food stuck to it. If you want to try this place anyways, take my advice: don't.
author: Emma M.

description:
Excellent food that is fast and friendly.
I eat here probably 3 times a week. Tasty every time and friendly staff as well.
I prefer this place to other taquerias in the neighborhood.
author: Justin A.

description:
Food is ok. Carne asada no good. Pollo is the only good meat in my opinion. Enchilada sauce has too much cinnamon. Don't get wet style burrito. 

The cashier isn't very friendly. One of the Mexican women working to cook the meat and make the plates is very friendly. The other larger woman is very UNFRIENDLY.   

I think overall I'd check out other places.
author: T L.

description: The burrito is okay here, but the service is below average to me. The lady at the cashier looks so mean, don't even smile or say "hi". I will not recommended. Rather go to the one a block away or the one on "Burrito Express"
author: Jasper K.

description:
La Fonda is one of MY FAVORITE Mexican food restaurants in the city/ever.
I order the Tofu Ranchero, at least 3 times a week, and it is .. the bomb.
They serve Vegan and Vegetarian friendly dishes, which isn't that easy to find .. and they are absolutely delish! The salsa is bomb and they have all the tortilla options available. :)
author: Michelean W.

description:
Let's start with the facts.

Pros:  Clean, modern, great prices.

Cons: salsa isn't great 

Five of us entered this establishment to get burritos. Tart by tart was closed and gordos is a shameful experience. So why not try the new spot? 

The main issue I have is the rationing of salsa. You are only given two thin small plastic cups for salsa.
 
The burrito itself wasn't that bad and I would dare to say actually decent. Better then gordos for sure but for us in the sunset. We are faced with no real options unfortunately.
author: Nathan A.

description: Food is exactly what one would expect and it is reasonably priced. I also hella dig the interior, which is painted in varying shades of orange and yellow - it contrasts nicely with the bleak sunset weather outside. Definitely not a place hipsters would like though, so if you are a farmer that lives in Hayes Valley (or some such level of ridiculous / wealth) this is not a place you'd like!!
author: Robert W.

description: I had the smothered aztec burrito. It was a large portion, but the taste was marginal. The food came out quick. It comes with free chips, but no refills and the salsa is just ok. There is nowhere to put your dirty dishes so people just leave them at the tables and you have to move them yourself.
author: Tonni R.

description:
Tacos are on the expensive side, but decent. I recommend the cochinita pibil tacos. I also recommend the huarache with chicken mole.

The agua de Jamaica was very refreshing!
author: Jose H.

description: Asked them to take the Guac off my burrito because they hadn't folded it yet and it was just scooped on top. Lady told me 'sorry it was already made'. Would have taken one second to scoop off they just scooped on it. They refused and I had to deal with it. Burrito didn't taste it hat good anyways. Had to throw 3/4 of it away. I regret tipping.
author: Oretola T.

description:
Tasty food, excellent selection, reasonable prices, and fast, friendly service.
Ate here for a quick lunch. Ordered the super veggie burrito.
author: Jules M.

description: I usually hate the idea of giving a small business a bad wrap but for the sake of Inner Sunset community, I feel it is my duty to stop patrons from experiencing what I feel is the worst customer service in the Inner Sunset and maybe all of San Francisco.  The food isn't so bad but the women behind the counter are so mean and nasty I cant force myself to enter anymore.   I've given it a shot a few times and every time my experience has varied from the staff ignoring me to the staff seemingly laughing at me for what I ordered (whatever I was hungry).  Another time the woman behind the counter yelled at me "Hello?? Is anybody home?"    Lots of great fast eats in the Inner Sunset to choose from, just don't go here.
author: Katie R.

description: Rude rude and rude. Food was good but I got turned off with the customer service the cashier provided. I understand that she was pregnant but still no excuse. If my son wasn't hungry I would of asked for my money back and went elsewhere.
author: Dave R.

description:
Their milanesa tortas are the main reason I come here.

It's a fairly small establishment with an upstairs place to sit if you need a bit more room. Small beer selection from $3-3.50.

People that work here are nice enough. Decent music most of the time. 

Big windows! Sometimes they leave them open and you can grab a table next to them.

Chomps!
author: Eric D.

description: I recently ordered the Chile Relleno plate. It was tasty yet the large pepper was tough and it was difficult to chew. I did like the filling, rice and beans and the green salsa and chips were good. The corn tortillas were small, and bland. I have ordered the chicken burritos before. They are o.k. but bland. The chicken tostada salad was bland, Maybe they just need things spicier and things would be better.
author: Donna C.

description: This wasn't disastrous, food was edible - not great, but the staff was pretty rude. They two behind the counter were laughing back and forth at me while preparing my order. I had heard about this before I first went from friends in the neighborhood, but I was still pretty surprised when it happened. I've been there twice and both times the staff was being snarky. It was bizarre. Just go to Crepevine or Plutos if you're hungry and right there. And Gordo Taqueria is right around the corner if you need Mexican.
author: Dylan D.

description:
I don't have high expectations when it comes to mexican food. All I ask is a well stuffed burrito filled with flavorful tender cuts of meat, seasoned rice and all the typical fresh fixings. In my mind, that shouldn't be too hard to pull off especially when you consider how easy it is to marinate the meat and slow cooking it to perfection. 

Well La Fonda clearly missed that mark. Everything was bland and lacked seasoning especially the meat. The only thing that helped add any level of flavors were from the salsa. Perhaps my taste buds were off but then again everyone at my table, 5 other people agreed it lacked flavors, we all can't be wrong.

Overall Thoughts

Truly a lackluster place for burritos but at least the price point is fare
author: Eddie W.

description:
The food here is bland.

The customer service is not great.

The dining area is tiny and there is often nowhere to sit.

The only reason, I believe, this place has decent reviews is because of the convenience of the location and the fact that there isn't another decent Mexican place in the Inner Sunset.
author: Nic Y.

description:
no.  

i should've listened to my inner voice.  
i was across the street getting a turkish wrap, and was also craving a burrito.  since this place was located right across the street, i went ahead and ventured in.

first of all, the lady working the counter gave me a weird/bad vibe. it felt rushed and she didn't seem polite at all.  after interacting with her i felt like i should've just walked out the door.  she was unpleasant to deal with.  when a white couple walked into this place after us, she was more warm towards them.  i'm not going to say she's a racist or something, maybe she knew them as regulars or something.

anyways, i got the aztecia.  which is a wet burrito and when i asked for more sauce containers, she said it'll cost 50 cents each.  really now?  this is the first place i've been where they charge extra for those tiny sauce containers.  that's pretty stingy if you ask me.

when we got the food, we took it back home. 
the burrito was dry on the inside, the meat was kinda lacking flavor,  but i guess that's why they made it a wet burrito, so it could kinda mask the bland meat.

the worst thing is that, after eating this, my stomach felt weird a few hours later.  it wasn't as bad a food poisoning, but i highly question their cleanliness or quality of meat they used in the burrito.  

i will never come back and will try and recommend people to find mexican food elsewhere.
author: Jeff K.

description:
I have so much catching up to do! I went to SF several months ago but I've been so busy ugh haha just kidding I'm not such a basic sorostitute. 

The burritos here are aight. Nothing truly special about em. Sorry that's all I got it.
author: Jerry B.

description:
the portions are pretty small. I got a regular burrito that looked like a baby burrito. the burrito was as thin as a 8oz can of soda and the length was about 7 to 8 inches. very little ingredients. there was maybe 5 pieces of meat in the burrito, mainly refried beans.
Been here several times, and each time is getting worse, not coming back anymore.
The cashier was more into playing games or being on her cell phone that helping patrons.
author: Jim S.

description:
Okay, La Fonda is not the most amazing Mexican in SF. But it is seriously solid, and it's the best budget Mexican in the Inner Sunset. I have had many many meals here. Burritos are well balanced, and they have a good mix of less standard dishes (get the Sopes and Panuchos!). Plus the ladies that run the place are super nice. And the salsa bar! OMG, half the time I came it was so I could load up on the salsas and pickled jalapenos.

So, if you're in the hood and don't feel like waiting for a table at Nopalitos, go here. Don't go to that revolting excuse for a restaurant Gordo. And that booth in Tart to Tart, wow, some of the blandest Mexican ever. You gotta satisfy that craving at La Fonda.
author: Aaron G.

description:
Are you from this neighborhood?
Somewhat... What are you looking for?
The cheapest burrito around.

Good prices and a good tasting veggie burrito!
author: Nathan P.

description: Side of meat. Lots of food. Was nothing to write home about, but also didn't hate it.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Nothing special... thought it would be more authentic when i stopped by to eat there... 
but more like a Chipotle fast food style... the salsa station and food station didn't look that clean not sure how fresh ingredients are. Staff wasn't particularly friendly or helpful. Got a chicken burrito - got it "spicy" but not spicy at all... hardly any flavor in chicken so i had to add bunch of salsa. I didn't want to finish it was not that good...

Not impressed not going back.
author: jess c.

description:
I came here for dinner and ordered the super burrito with carnitas. It was pretty standard, so it was pretty good. The carnitas was perfectly cooked, but the tortilla ended up being drenched in its juices. It was a pretty cold night, so I wanted a Mexican chocolate, but they didn't make any that day. :(

The upstairs seating was very cute, and the workers were friendly.
author: Rachel H.

description: Decent little Mexican place in an area not known for its Mexican cuisine. I'm glad you're open when you are...coming home late from work this is my go to.  The pastor tacos are rico. I assume most people don't eat anything other than burritos here....I suggest trying everything but the burritos.
author: Matthew F.

description:
Mmmm Mexican food. 

I ordered a burrito with carnitas, beans, rice, guac, sour cream, lettuce. I forget the name of it. It was a little pricey, around $10. Free chips which was awesome and fresh salsal (mild, medium, hot) available to serve yourself. We grabbed to go cups for the salsa and went on our way. 

My burrito was very yummy. Huge might I add. My complaint was the sauce. It was a weird sweet flavor that just didn't pair well with the burrito.The guac and sour cream was also put on the outside of my burrito which I wasnt a fan of.
author: Laura G.

description:
Went in for an early lunch on Saturday. 
We ordered a torta and the huevos rancheros. The woman who took my order corrected my pronunciation of conchita pibil, which I guess was super nice of her. Then she asked if we wanted cheese on the huevos rancheros. Yup, sounds good thanks.  Beans? Black. Torta spicy or mild? Spicy please. Really? You bet.

She handed me my charge slip to sign. I put in the total without the tip as I always put that in the jar, which she saw me do. Just saying.  

Went upstairs to eat our complimentary chips and salsa and do the crossword puzzle while waiting. Then we looked down and saw that our order was up, so the kid went down to collect it. She had some discussion while I was trying to figure out a crossword clue. Then she lugged the tray up the steep stairs. Thank you kid;  my knees are not so good anymore.

Well? It was ok. The conchita pibil was really good, but for me a torta needs more than meat on an untoasted cold bun. I am looking at pictures of other people's tortas and that is not what we got;  no lettuce, no cheese, no tomato, no avocado. Kid reported that she had to ask for them to please give us jalapenos and was told they were 'too spicy.' She said she had to insist, and in the end got them on the side, so we put them in the torta ourselves. That was weird. I kind of wish she had insisted on all of the vegetables and a toasted bun too, but I guess after the difficulty getting jalapenos she gave up. 

The huevos rancheros were fine, with a tiny sprinkling of cheese. I put the stellar green salsa all over them and that green salsa could make a shoe taste amazing. 

Yes, I actually do think I'd go back and just be really really clear about how I want everything prepared. I kind of think the problem was that it was a Saturday and early, as all of the ingredients were really good, just not put together well.
author: El B.

description: I was impressed with La Fonda. I got a chorizo taco and an huevos a la mexicana. Both of these dishes filled me up easily. The prices here are also very reasonable. I would say it's a great value for the amount of food you get and the great taste. They also have a salsa bar with three or four salsas to choose from.
author: Lynn T.

description: Do you like bland food? Love sub-par service? Cold pre-made food? Being charged 25 cents per salsa cup (the small thimbles that most eateries give you 20 of) if you go over the two that comes with your order? THEN THIS IS THE PLACE FOR YOU!!! Go to the Mexican stand in Tart to Tart - that lady is super nice and the food kicks this places ass.
author: Cat S.

description: So disappointed- they charged me for guacamole and sour cream and I got home and there was none. The quesadilla lacked CHEESE. I just don't like the vibe of the place, not very friendly, not well kept, and now food is just sub-par - good bye.
author: Claudia V.

description: This is our go to Mexican place in the Inner Sunset. Solid food, good service.
author: Susan B.

description:
I went here for lunch and orderd the Azteca Burrito with chicken and black beans. The burrito was huge and covered in sauce. The grilled chicken was good. The rice was slightly over cooked. I liked the salsa bar. The salsas seemed very fresh.

Seating is a little cramped. Water is self served. You order at the counter and pick up your food when your order is ready.
author: Alexander L.

description: Good neighborhood Mexican restaurant. Everything is always fresh and the staff are friendly and efficient.  I have to admit they have drastically reduced their portion size recently. Maybe they have done this to avoid raising prices, but the servings are pretty skimpy now.
author: Faye M.

description:
One word: BLAND

I've had La Fonda a few times in the past and never cared for the food. But today I decided to try it again since it has been over a year and I live really close to the restaurant. And once again I'm disappointed. Seems like they never use salt for anything. The steak was bland & so was the rice leaving me a tasteless burrito that I needed to smother with hot sauce.

I won't be back!!! I've gave this place to many chances and I can get a burrito somewhere else that's also fairly close.
author: Nicole V.

description: Giving two stars solely based on quality of food. Portions good - got a super burrito, but just tasted very, very ok - for 8 bucks.... there are better options for a few extra dollars around Irving.
author: Henry H.

description: If i can give this place a 0 star I would.....  #1 Rude owner And staff. #2 nasty food. Doesn't aim to please the customer any way around. And i am a real honest reviewer..... So take my word. Yuck!!!!!
author: Lisa N.

description: Two out of our three orders were wrong. My burrito was ice cold. Tortillas were barely cooked. The flavors were all around terrible. Poor excuse for a Mexican restaurant. Don't even bother...
author: Rob M.

description:
Lately I have noticed that if you don't tip, or if you do tip but they don't see, your burrito sucks. ( very think extra tortilla hanging off) and they jip you on chips ( two separate orders, still one tiny bowl of seriously 7 chips) Am I really controlling the outcome of my food based on whether you SEE my tip?!

They still haven't improved their attitude ( not friendly at all) and don't even say thanks when you do tip. Knowledge on customer service = zero.

I've decided this place isn't worth it, the atmosphere isn't welcoming so enjoying your food is tough.
author: Anna B.

description: Found a really big, sharp chicken bone (see pic) in my burrito a couple bites in. Was a little nervous to eat the rest so I just showed the woman at the counter the bone and asked for a refund. She refused, said I can have something else. I explained I didn't want more food from here just a refund but she said no refund. Will never come back completely unacceptable. Not to mention dangerous.
author: Kelsey C.

description:
Like other people have noted here, they are very cheap with the chips, and they are not generous with the portions if you don't tip, and they do this really annoying thing where they throw your burrito in the microwave and nuke it for a minute on the plate or in the container to make it hot.  One time I hadn't known that they did that and I almost burned myself picking up the plate!
  I told the waitress about it once and she gave me an annoyed look.  Tell them not to do that with your food and see how they react.  :)

The good:   The sauces are very nice, and the azteca burrito is great for the price. I absolutely love the tomato salsa with the cilantro and onion!   And the tomatillo salsa is very nice too.

 A tip to the cashier:  I think she could use a little bit of an attitude adjustment, because she doesn't seem to really care. But on the whole I have overlooked all that for that tasty burrito!  Mmm mmm!
author: Sarah L.

description: Stopped by here looking for a quick bite to eat late at night and I was super surprised that I liked it. I love Mexican food and usually trek over to the mission to get my fix. I would give this a four star rating for Mexican food in the sunset. It's a little pricey and they skimp a bit on the meat fillings but overall the taste is good. I also love a decent salsa bar and their pico de gallo was pretty tasty. Chips were ok but I think they buy them from elsewhere.
author: Alice H.

description: I'm along time  local of this hood and have worked in the restaurant industry nearby. Inner sunset doesn't have great Mexican. Sorry folks. Taco shop at underdogs is probably the best, which is a bit sad since it's a sports bar. But the bad reviews here are un-justified. I've eaten here tons of times over my years in the hood. It's not the best in town by a long shot but it's good. A tiny bit hit and miss but pretty darn solid. The panuchos and sopes are great. Burritos are big. You won't be disappointed if you just want some simple California taqueria fare.
author: Art V.

description:
Even when there are a lot of people lined up I know I'm going to get my food hot and fast. I usually get my good to go, but even when I dine in alone it's a good experience.

The prices here are not bad, and I always feel like I'm getting a good deal. When I dine here alone I never tip and the staff has never mistreated me or my food.
author: Coltin C.

description: I have come to eat here quite a few times always hoping that they will have better customer service. I have yet to be treated well by the staff here. They are always rude and in a hurry to get me out the door. I have never had this sort of experience at any other restaurant. Their food is fine, but the bad attitude keeps me away.
author: Todd A.

description: I tried La Fonda for the first time last night and loved it. I'm not vegetarian, but I saw that they had 5 types of vegetarian burritos so I ordered the steamed broccoli burrito and it was delicious (steamed broccoli, cheese, rice, beans). Their salsas are also great, and my burrito came out quickly. I would definitely go back.
author: Brooke R.

description:
I was looking for a Mexican restaurant on Irving St and we decided to give this place a try. While I respect this restaurant for having a number of vegetarian selections, including burritos with tofu, I wasn't happy with what I chose. I ordered the Chile Relleno burrito. It was really greasy! It also seemed to have too much cheese and not much flavor. I included a pic where you can see all the oil coming out...
My friend got a basic chicken burrito which he found dry and somewhat bland. 
In addition, they have an upstairs eating area which is cool. But it overlooks the grill and there was a ton of dust on top of the grill machine! They should really clean it up.
author: Greg C.

description: The service is incredibly slow and the quality of the food does not make up for it. The burrito was wrapped in such a rush that it completely fell apart. Have given the place a few tries but it's been pretty much the same every time. Definitely not coming back again.
author: Eric J.

description: Pretty good and fast burritos.  They are super friendly and the burritos are large!  They have a salsa bar for dripping onto your awesome burrito.  The amount of chips provided is on the light side.  The plates are good too.
author: Ryan I.

description:
In the Inner Sunset I can't think of another place that serves better Mexican food than La Fonda.  I've only eaten here twice, both recently, but I've enjoyed my meals here.  The staff is nice, the restaurant is clean, the portions are filling and the food is very good.

A big bowl of complimentary chips come with each meal and you can help yourself at the iced down salsa bar which features two types of red sauce, a tomatillo sauce (my favorite), whole jalapenos, chopped onion and chopped cilantro.

On my first visit I had an enchilada plate with chorizo (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/GPK6hwD_EGKCRVD1cWESig?select=w_ny-F33_YCddhpWBQL5fQ).  They offer you a choice of beans and I chose the black beans which is my default choice.  The enchiladas here are not rolled but are actually just meat inside a tortilla folded over like a taco and smothered in cheese and enchilada sauce.  The chorizo was very good with just a tad of kick.  I prefer more spice and found one of the red sauces in the salsa bar perfect for developing a little moisture on my forehead.  A small side of fresh, chunky guacamole is served on the side.  The guac here combines ripe avocado with chunks of fresh tomatoes and chopped onions.  It, too, was very good.

On my second visit I decided to try La Fonda's version of a wet burrito.  More often than not I tend to like my Mexican food smothered in cheese or smothered in sauce so whenever I dine in the chances are fairly high that I will order something smothered in cheese or sauce.  In this case my Azteca Burrito was smothered with both (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/GPK6hwD_EGKCRVD1cWESig?select=JwWhOT74QTXoIYrC81Cslg).  I ordered it with broiled steak and whole black beans.  The steak is precooked, chopped and reheated on the grill upon ordering.  The preparation time was very fast even with a steady flow of customers coming in.  The modified enchilada sauce had some nice spice to it and the burrito was overstuffed and wrapped up plump.

For hydration La Fonda carries many of your favorite beers and they have several varieties of agua frescas.  For me though I like that they have Mexican Coke and several varieties of Jarritos Mexican soda.

For excellent Mexican food you can find me somewhere in the Mission, but if I'm in the Inner Sunset and I feel like having above average Mexican food then La Fonda is my preferred choice.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
This is one of the better taquerias in the city, and compares well with Cancun, Farolito, El Toro, etc down in the Mission.

I think they favor a slightly different style than those other places, and that may be some kind of regional thing.  They have a few items on the menu which seem sort of exotic in comparison to the standard carne asada/carnitas/pollo asado burrito lineup.  

I like the alambre, which is bacon, grilled peppers and onions served with tortillas.

The seating can be a bit cramped during peak hours, which are typically 6-7pm.

It looks like a few princesses below have given them some bad reviews for the service, but I've never had a problem here.  It's an order-and-pickup-at-the-counter sort of place, so I'm not really sure what the problem could be, except that maybe some people expect a counter person to kiss their ass a little bit while they deliberate over whether or not to get that burrito wrapped in a plain or spinach tortilla.
author: Gopal R.

description:
Well... I had a bite.

My friend ordered a burrito and got some guac on the side.

- Sorry ya'll, that ain't no god damn guac. Ya... its got avocado and tomato and onion.... but way to bland. I am a mexican... you gotta make me proud.
+/- Burrito was okay too.... just okay. Kinda soggy.

Thats all I can remember.....I am still on the hunt for a good mexican place in SF. Since I come from the east bay, I have a feeling it's impossible to find the place that has the best tacos. Only thing my bf has found is a taco truck at his work downtown.
author: Julia D.

description:
BOOM! 

Sensational burrito from the first taste to the last bite 

(well, it was for me- I could only finish half of it the "Azteca"-it's huge!)

Really fresh ingredients, super-tasty burritos and probably the hottest and best homemade salsa on their salsa bar. 

They also give you a generous side of warm, homemade tortilla chips

(because you might have a tiny space in your pinkie to pack them away after eating the burrito)

Delish!
author: Jennifer O.

description: The customer service is neither good nor bad, the food lacks freshness, The taste is OK..I was wondering,while giving my order, if the cleaning is on fleek thought?? maybe the price is interesting but I prefer to pay more for a better food quality... I hope that the comments will help them to get better, but until then, I'm getting my tacos somewhere else..
author: Ka L.

description:
Nice spot in the Sunset for Mexican/Cuban food. 

Quick and Great Service. 

Food was good overall. 

Nothing to write home about but i would definitely grab a bite from here again. 

I had the Torta Cubana and was impressed with my order.
author: Matthew M.

description: Used to really like this place.   Came in for my usual burrito and the woman at the cash register started talking with her coworker about another order. Then she took my$20 and kept talking, not knowing that she placed my money into the register and was retrieving my change and placed a $10 bill on top of the money tray. When she stopped talking, she looked at me and said 'u gave me $10, right? I said , 'no' I gave u $20.  I think this is a 'scam'.  I looked at her and said it again and she  insisted that I gave her $10.  I let her keep the $10 telling her that maybe she shouldn't be talking while taking my order . I won't be coming back.
author: Teresa J.

description:
4 stars- not becasue of ambiamce or the interior. It is the food!! It's amazing!!

I'm typically not a big fan of mexican food, but I found a place that I actually crave. I always get the super shrimp burritto, its so delish. get it to go..
author: Muneera M.

description:
Taken off 1 Star cos they're terribly Stingy with Chips & Salsa - I asked for some extra Chips & containers for Salsa & they looked at me as if I was asking them if I could draw blood!!! 

Seriously, what's their problem?! 

My favourite Mexican spot in the Sunset District (Inner & Outer) they are perfect to satisfy any Mexican craving! Eat in or get it as a take away. Their super burritos are SUPER delicious! Add grilled mushrooms.. sooo good. Their quesadillas are also v nice.. Their Menu has  a wide variety of items which is nice apart from all of the usual staples - burritos tacos quesadillas nachos etc. Salsa bar and chips are delicious. Food is consistent and I come here on a regular basis for take-aways and I even prefer them to some of the places I have tried in the Mission. Its slightly more pricey but worth it and you can trust the food is good and not dodgy. They accept credit cards which is convenient as well. They are open late and I don't recommend bringing children - shouting children no good. This also probably isnt the place for ppl who are super particular cos everything is ready-made such as meat/rice/beans & they just put ig together for you.
author: Julian I.

description:
I stopped eating here months ago because I got sick two times in a row after having their tacos. The line at Gordos was slow so I figured I'd give La Fonda another shot. I asked for chilli verde on my burrito the girl at the counter snaps at me rudely saying they don't have it. I get a carne asada super burrito. A quarter of the way through eating it I open it up because I'm consuming nothing but mushy rice. The "Super Burrito" barely has any freaking meat I take it to the counter and let them know I won't be eating it that I literally opened it up to see if they put meat in it and they look at me stupidly no apologize or anything "we only put a spoonful in." I was freaking hungry and did not pay for a tortilla and mushy rice. An $8+ burrito should include more than a spoonful of meat end of story. Really disappointing would like my money back.

I'm editing this to let you guys know the quarter of "burrito" that I did eat made me sick. I use to love this place in college too bad it's no longer even edible.
author: Marisa M.

description:
After living in Inner Sunset for over a year, I finally gave La Fonda a try.  The place doesn't look to big from the outside, but surprisingly, there is a second story with a good amount of seating, inside.  The menu is pretty standard for a Mexican restaurant and the prices are pretty fair.  It's not as cheap as some other Mexican restaurants, but it's by no means pricey.  

My boyfriend and I ordered a couple things to share:
-Chips (free): nothing special, but I still liked them.

-Super carne asada burrito (about $7.50):pretty large for one person to finish unless you're really hungry.  You get your choice of meat and beans.  It wasn't as hot as I would have liked, but it was fine.  The portion of meat was very fair, but the flavor of it was just okay.  

-Special item (I think it was called cachula or something?) ($3.95): this was pretty interesting.  It was some spicy pork and pink onions sandwiched between two thick corn tortilla type pieces.  (I know that description wasn't that great, but it tasted pretty good).  I've never had this anywhere else before, but it was one of the specials, on a printed sign by the cash register.  My boyfriend really enjoyed the pork and we both thought it tasted good.  The weird thing is that we both had two intensely spicy bites from the dish- but the rest was only mildly spicy.

Overall, the restaurant was really clean and the service was fine.  They call the name of the dish/item out when it's ready, so make sure that you're listening.  I'll probably be back at some point to try out other dishes.  

Notes:
-It seems like they do a lot of to-go business.
-Self-serve salsa bar (3 types of salsa, onions, cilantro and peppers).
-Self-serve water station.
author: Samantha L.

description:
Had a negative experience .

The burrito was cold .  Three employees paid no attention to he during the ordering process. They assumed it was to go . They never asked , if it was for here . Think it's rude for the employees to be chit chatting while the customer is ordering . I did switch to spanish and was better able to communicate . 

I would not. Return ever
author: cole g.

description:
Disclaimer: I mainly come here for the breakfast burritos and huevos rancheros which are served all day.

The portions are usually more than enough, and the ingredients are tastier than Chipotle in my opinion. It's nice to have the option of Mexican food in the Sunset, where more restaurants tend to be Asian or Italian. 

Orders come with complementary chips and salsa, and the service is friendly but efficient. I'm used to not spending a lot of time here because I generally take advantage of the calling in and picking up my order. I have eaten here once with some co-workers in the upstairs area after a happy hour, so it's a good option for groups who need a clean space. It's not meant to be a particularly dine-y place, but I like it here and I'll keep coming back for the breakfast food.
author: Alice H.

description:
- Azteca carnitas burrito was a beauty. Next time I'll get mas queso. 
- prices about the same as other taquerias in Sunset, especially for how much you get
- clean
- fast (they need to be - they're busy)
- glad my daughter didn't see the free nachos or she wouldn't have eaten her beans
- eating by an open window is almost as nice as eating outside
author: Scott J.

description:
Restaurant is clean and welcoming, just like the neighborhood it's in. The staff are attentive and that's about it. I ordered a couple salsa selections with some old-ish chips, and huevos rancheros, which turned out to be delicious. Wasn't too sure what to do with my plates so I just left them on the upper level. Place looked good for small groups in the upstairs area and small tables downstairs. 
You get your own water in plastic cups. Horchata was grainy and thick, if that's the kind you like.
author: Emma G.

description: I don't think I'll be back. I have now ordered from her twice. Both times I called in the order and picked up. Both times I ordered a grilled chicken super burrito, it comes with sour cream, guacamole and cheese. Both times I was charged for a super burrito both times I got a regular burrito without sour cream, nor cheese, nor guacamole. So annoying. Maybe they do that because I'm picking up and I won't realize it until I'm long gone and  I won't complain? I don't know but I can't go back and find out. Plus the flavor is just blah. No thank you.
author: Rachel D.

description: I already had pizza at the Arizmendi bakery so wasn't super Hungry and my friends wanted to get Mexican. I got something "small", a fish taco and a flan. It was good, the salsa was fresh and the flan was alright.
author: Eleonora B.

description:
Alright,  La Fonda the line in the sand has been drawn. Adios. I will not return and patronize this establishment again. 

First off, the food is just mediocre.   There is no excuse for sub-par Mexican food in San Francisco  but for some reason the inner sunset is the exception to rule.

Anyways, I guess what really upsets me is the salsa policy. You are only given 2 togo containers to package your salsa. Is it wrong that I want a third?  Am I being excessive?

The only reason I want three containers is because the salsa I want you to add to my burrito is not behind the counter.  I like the green kind because it offers the most flavor. The "hot" is never spicy or hot enough. The mild is rather bland. Whats the deal? There is no other place in city that is this chincy with the salsa.
author: Joey L.

description:
The food is pretty good but-- Why is the staff so rude?  I consider myself a regular at this place because I love Mexican food and, unfortunately, this is one of the only taquerias in the Inner Sunset.  The workers are consistently annoyed, apathetic and just don't care what anyone thinks about their eye rolling, rude behavior.

Tonight I went in for a quesadilla and left with a WTF sour taste in my mouth.  Even though the staff is rude, they do offer free chips and 2 small salsa cups with each order. But tonight the lady declared that I could only have 1 cup because the price of tomatoes has gone up.  What?. 

 I just spent $10.00 on a quesadilla (I was charged extra for wanting guac and sour cream w/ the meat and cheese).   I was there 3 days ago and received 2 cups... for the past 7 years, I have received 2 cups.  So why is it different tonight?  Because the rude person working the register made a decision that the price of tomatoes are too high to give me another teaspoon without charging me extra.  She said it with a straight face-- even though she recognized me from the many other times I'd been there. She knew that I knew better but she looked right thru me.   WTF?

This may sound like I'm being picky but it is part of the larger problem-- The staff at this place is so rude.  So off-putting.  So angry at you for wanting to patronize the establishment.  How dare I voluntarily pay $10.00 for a basic quesadilla and expect to receive the same chips and salsa that is routine.  How dare i?

Please-- will someone open up a new taqueria in the Inner Sunset? Please?  This place obviously doesn't want to be in business anymore.  

And if the price of salsa is too high to offer it gratis to your customers anymore then please put up a sign to tell us about the policy change.  But if you can't afford the price of salsa maybe it is time to get out of the Mexican food business.  That may be best, all things considered.
author: Niki G.

description:
Prices have sure gone up since the summer. An Azteca burrito (which is the only thing I get from here, I did get tamales once but I'd rather stick to this) would cost about $6 something a couple months ago but now it's $8!!!!

I can only come here with a coupon, if I don't, I would feel jipped.

Instead of costing around $10 for 2 burritos, 2 drinks & complimentary chips & salsa, it's closer to $13.
author: Kylie L.

description:
Average is the only way to describe this place, not impressive. I came here after craving some Mexican and being around the area at the time. The place had a decent amount of seating and appears good from the outside. To start of I decided to order a shrimp quesadilla and super burrito with carnitas. The quesadilla was for my gf and she said it was not too bad and was happy with the available option of a wheat tortilla. For me on the other hand I did not enjoy my burrito and finished about half of it before throwing it away. A big deal breaker for me is fat in my meat, I had to spit out the meat 2 times in a span of three bites due to large chunks of fat in my burrito, this is not only disgusting but ruins your appetite since your analyzing every bite from that moment on to check out if there is fat or not. I was pretty upset with the flavor as well, no savoriness or flavor in the meat, when I added salsa to it that was about all I tasted aside from the black bean, bland and gross. The chips were good and thankfully provided me some satisfaction along with the salsas. 
I don't recommend this spot, there are dozens of different Mexican places you can check out that are much better.
author: Josue V.

description:
Best burrito in SF

Firstly, let me say how rare it is to find a place which includes a full (mini) basket of free chips with a burrito... This alone puts it above most Mexican restaurants and taquerias in the city. Next, the salsa that also comes for free in a mini salsa bar is both flavorful and fresh! I had as my main entree the super vegetarian burrito which (at the time of this writing) was under $6 and it's medium size was a good value for what you're getting. The refried beans had flavor and seemed like they cared about vegetarian needs. They also had a large menu of other vegetable burritos which made me want to come back and try those. So far it's the best burrito I've had inside of SF, which for a good city is seriously lacking in Mexican excellence in is food. Normally I have to drive outside of the city to Alameda to find a really great burrito. This is a good local place.
author: Curtis M.

description:
I am quite picky when it comes to Mexican food but for Inner Sunset, this place does it! Plus, you get complimentary chips and salsa, so you can't beat that. Note: the salsa could be more spicy, don't get your hopes up.

The burritos are large and taste really good... I really like the Alambre (skirt steak, cheese, onions, bell pepers with 3 tortillas), which for $5.50 fills you entirely! You can order for take-out; I prefer to take my food and eat upstairs.
author: Marissa P.

description:
My first visit and I have mixed feelings already. To me, the test of a good Mexican place is the mole. Unfortunately, the legendary sauce here is just not up to par.

Why oh why?! Not that it's bad mole. I would say it's just ok. It needs more spices, more chocolate, it needs something. Its taste was just too bland, which makes me wonder how that happens since mole had all that chile and nut goodness, not to mention the chocolate. 

There was some light at the end of this tunnel, though. The chicken the mole covered was delicious - tender and juicy. The sopas were also pretty yummy. And my hubby's cochinita pork was delish. The salsas are fresh and the horchata was pleasant.

Overall, ok experience. I would eat here again, but I would skip the mole.
author: Yelena K.

description: Delicious variety of fresh salsas. Homemade chips that weren't too salty. The chicken fajita burrito was excellent. Extremely delicious value play
author: Scott T.

description: I really like this place.  The empanadas are wonderful.  Staff are helpful and friendly.  A cut above the standard burrito place.
author: Sam M.

description:
Stopped in for a quick lunch -- food came out quickly and tasted pretty good. I had the Azteca burrito with carnitas and refried beans.

The person taking our order wasn't terribly friendly and seemed annoyed that we wanted to order. I asked for spicy but the burrito wasn't spicy at all.

Although it's a small restaurant, they have an upstairs with more tables.
author: Allen W.

description:
Food was alright, I could have easily given this place 3 stars but the women working the counter was beyond rude. She never told me my total just stuck her hand out to receive my payment. I asked her for a cup for water and she just shoves an empty cup in my face and doesn't even tell me where I can get water from. 

The ambiance is that of any other small taqueria.  The upstairs seating is muggy and hot, a lot of the tables were off balance which made for an irritating and unpleasant dining experience.
author: Angelica  C.

description:
I hope the owner of La Fonda reads this. I'm a Sunset local who has been eating here since they opened. The first few years I would have rated it 5 stars, but in the last couple of years it seems the ownership have shown a total lack of interest in keeping this restaurant successful.

I usually order the cochinita super burrito, with chips and salsa on the side, and a Mexican coke. Then I liked to sit outside on sunny days and enjoy the people walking by as I ate. There was also a really sweet lady that use to work behind the counter, I think she lived on 8th Ave., the same block that I did at the time. She would always smile and chat a little, and I felt welcome like there was a true neighborhood vibe about this place.

So here's my experience in the last couple years:

No more chairs and tables outside, I guess the city didn't want them on the sidewalk anymore, but I wonder why the owners did not apply for a parklet seeing as this would be a great benefit to their customers? Many cafes, restaurants, etc., have been putting them in all over the city, and the program is great! 

After many years the nice lady that worked the counter is not there anymore, and the new ones are not friendly at all, some even have a grumpy attitude like they are doing you a favor to take your order. Maybe they don't get paid as well anymore, but I always tip them no matter what.

The decor of the place is badly in need of maintenance, the planter outside is beat, the window frames and walls are damaged, and need painted, hardwood floors need refinished, lights are out and dirty, and the whole place needs a deep cleaning and degreasing. It just looks grubby and not kept up like a food serving establishment should be.

Lastly, and most importantly, the food. I have noticed a sharp decrease in portion size on my super burrito, I don't know if that is the person making it, or the owner has told them to take it down a couple notches to save money? Also the chip portions are now smaller too. I used to walk out of here stuffed, sometimes couldn't even finish and would save some for later, but not anymore. I felt like the super burrito has become the normal burrito and was missing the extras that I payed for.

Wake up La Fonda, don't let things slide much further, it's obvious. I won't be going back until I notice some changes for the better.
author: Aaron C.

description:
Food is very mediocre, but what really brings this place down is the service.  The counter staff is not friendly and routinely gets my order wrong - virtually every time.  It's very possible the issue is that they are understaffed on weekdays so it's understandable that the counter staff would be grumpy and inattentive (they're ringing up and assembling orders AND cooking simultaneously in most cases).  They never seem to have anyone busing tables either, so if you eat in you are dodging spilled salsa and old plates that haven't been cleared away.  

Hoping things improve so I can write a positive updated review!
author: Jill H.

description: Best al pastor in the neighborhood. The ladies who own the place can be a little standoffish, but you get used to it. Free chips/salsa, which differs from Gordo down the street. Solid spot.
author: Alex S.

description:
Nachos and traditional burrito were ok

Cramped seating and the service attitude is only so so. 

Price was moderate.

Wishing we would have found something better...
author: Patrick S.

description:
The background: Mexican food restaurant that's not quite a fast food type joint, but not quite a sit down restaurant. Has a standard Mexican menu (buritos, fajitas, tacos, nachos, enchiladas, etc) and reasonably priced. 

The details: The food was well OK ... unfortunately somewhat bland, nothing special or mouthwatering. I got a burito and the carne asada was ok, the rice beans size ok. I can't say terrible things about them or terribly great. Although, I would prefer eating a burito bowl at chipotle, but sometimes you just are in the neighborhood wishing for carne asada. 

FYI - there's seating upstairs, but you'll be forced to carry your burito, chips, and drink up the stairs on a tray so be careful... my burito almost went flying because the staircase is narrower and steeper than most.  Also - if you're on the journey to find Orange Bang in the city - this place will not have it! 

The verdict: It's good for hey it's lunch time I'm hungry and it's right by work or school. I wouldn't NOT come here again, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
author: Christine B.

description:
Dirty tables and sticky walls. 

Won't be back.  I DONT like La Fonda's Beef! It tastes frozen and old. 

You have to pay 1$ for a soda refill?? REALLY? My first cup was ALL ICE!! 


THE FEMALE WORKERS NEED TO WORK ON PEOPLE SKILLS! so rude.
author: Andrew V.

description:
Not sure if its intentional or not, but La Fonda feels a lot like a wannabe Papa Lote - the bright colors, the fonts on the menu board, even the weirdly long and totally unpractical layout for a dine-in restaurant.  When it comes to food though, La Fonda and Papa Lote are miles apart... 

FIrst the good.  The chips are very good - deep fried but not too oily and not too thick or thin.  The red salsa was also excellent, some sort of smoked tomato salsa with tanginess and a kick.  The chilaquiles we had were overall OK but had a fantastic red sauce (different from the red salsa) - would love to see if they make that themselves of buy it from the outside.  FInally, the chile relleno was pretty tasty - nothing too unique, just an overload of cheese and pepper, but tasty nonetheless. 

And now for the bad.  The shrimp fajitas were pretty throughly terrible, with under-cooked shrimp (too crunchy and fishy) and that lacked any flavor - I feel like they should have either made them much richer (with butter/oil) or spicier (garlic or chipotle or even just salt/pepper), but apparently they chose neither.  In both dishes we ordered the rice and pinto beans were both also very bland, which pretty much seals the deal on this place - a burrito place with bad rice and beans is like watch that can't keep time, all style and no substance.  

All in all a star for the salsa and chips, a second for the awesome chilaquiles red sauce...and that's it.
author: Rosers M.

description:
There is no reason to go back here. I went while watching the NIner's game next door at Yancy's to get something to hold me over until dinner. Ended up paying $7 for nachos that were essentially just chips and beans, with small traces of cheese and guacamole. REALLY?! How hard is it to screw up nachos?! 

My husband got a Torta and was also underwhelmed. Food was bland and nothing to write home about. WIshing we had grabbed pizza instead from next door.

Save yourself from the mistake and go somewhere else.
author: Kate V.

description:
Dirty tables. Screaming babies. Apathetic employees.

The food is top drawer, though. Really cheap, and they have crispy shells, shredded lettuce, shredded chicken, and big tomato slices. I'm used to "Mission Mexican" in SF, which seems to focus on authentic tacos with uncooked corn tortillas, cilantro, and white onion. That's why I like La Fonda -- I like the gluttonous touches of Americanized food. It doesn't hurt that they serve free chips with a salsa bar. 

They also have horchata drinks that are kind of amazing. I'm told they come in three flavors, lime, watermelon and cinnamon, though I've only ever seen the watermelon and cinnamon. I've tried both, and the cinnamon is too sweet for me. The watermelon is fabulous.
author: David S.

description: Decent Mexican food at decent prices. There's lots of kids here. They are actually really nice and helpful.
author: Genevieve B.

description:
Great Mexican food on Irving street? Is that like saying republicans in San Francisco (FiDi and Marina excluded)?

I was helping my buddy put together some IKEA furniture (woohoo?) and we went to grab some food down the street. 

La fonda mexican grill was bright and colorful inside. It was even...dare I say...clean.

I don't mean to hate, but most Mexican places with killer food are notthe cleanest places on the planet. 

I really liked their space. They had 10 or so seats downstairs and an upstairs area. 

I had the Azteca burrito which was 6.20 but they had a 4.95 one.

The azteca burrito, which is essentially a wet burrito was INSANELY good. 

I am definitely taking the N back to this place. 

Kudos!

I mean...felicidades!
author: Carlos A.

description: I normally go to Gordos (nearby) but was suggested to try this place. Got the steak super burrito. It was great and I will definitely be back.
author: James P.

description: Terrible food. I can't believe I made the mistake of coming here twice. Food has no flavor, meat is dry, and it reminds me of food I ate at my college dining room.
author: John C.

description: One of the best Mexican food around, I always get their tacos and they are delicious and hot. Highly recommended if you're in the area.
author: Zade T.

description: Good food but the service was horrible!! My son requested a side of scrambled eggs and the cashier said that couldn't be done. They had at least three items on the menu that came with eggs and she couldn't figure out how to charge for 2? Just overall not very friendly.
author: Erika E.

description: Went to a school event that this place catered... Can't remember the last time that I've been so sick from a meal!!! I had so much bloating and stomach cramps for 2 days after eating food from La Fonda. Don't put yourself through it!
author: EmyMig L.

description:
Horrible service! The cashier/counter person didn't crack a smile.

I just spent $9+ on a burrito and I was given 2 (2 oz) plastic containers for the salsa bar. I asked the woman at the counter for a 3rd container and she gave me a dirty look, so I told her it was for onions (as if it mattered what it was for). So, rather than giving me the container to help myself, she turned to her salsa bar behind the counter to fill it herself. She treated me like I was going to steal extra salsa - REALLY? Then she said that orders only come with 2 containers - for next time. I told I'm not coming back next time because she was so rude. She just shrugged and turned away.

As for the food: my burrito was mediocre tasting and it was supposed to be "super" but it was so small and I couldn't find the guacamole. There are so many better places to get a good burrito in SF. There's no room for the rude service. I'm never going back even if the food was free. If I could give NO STARS, I would !!
author: Charlene S.

description:
I've gone here a few times over the past year. The service is always great, very friendly and on top of it. The food is also always great. 

I love the fact that they open up the entire store front window in good weather, nothing like sitting inside, but also outside at the same time on those rare sunny days. 

Horchata here is wonderful!
author: Meghan L.

description: This is by far the best option in the neighborhood for cheap mexican food.  The burritos are decent, the tortas aren't bad, and they serve their breakfast options all day which is always nice to see.  Don't expect to be blown away, but if you're looking for a quick burrito in the Inner Sunset, this is where you need to be.  Just don't get the nachos, they're the only things I had here that I was really disappointed with.
author: Joshua W.

description: I love La Fonda.  I eat here at least 2x a week.  The beans are vegetarian, most everything is made in house, the food is clean and good.  They are super nice to me, and I'm a total pain in the butt.  I modify my burrito all the time and they are always accommodating and friendly.  They always use fresh ingredients.  Seriously the best burrito place in the inner sunset hands down, everyone I bring here always loves it.
author: K S.

description:
Our favorite dish here (me and my husband) are the tamales. Definitely. 

No, it's not the best mexican restaurant ever. But it's pretty good, and consistently delicious. The salsa bar is yummy and the chips are fresh. I've been here several times and each time I come, the food is tasty. I never walk away hungry. 

It beats trekking all the way to the mission and given the lack of latin options on the West side of town, La Fonda hits the spot for me. 

Any place that makes fresh chips and salsa is always a bonus for me.
author: Joanne D.

description: Food was on point, nothing to complain about. Hidden gem, make sure to grab a bite if you're in the area. Great prices, hole in the wall Mexican spot.
author: Saul L.

description:
Steak quesadilla delicious. Last time I told them no green onion and chives and what do I get? chives and green onions. Blah! 

Chips are dry. Sauce is self served. I always wanted to sit on the 2nd lfoor, maybe next time.
author: Jess W.

description:
La Fonda was a staple for me when I first moved to The City.....I lived on 11th and Irving, and just happened upon this place.....Since that day, I have eaten there about 20 times during my year in San Francisco!

The shrimp quesadilla is, hands down, the best I've ever tasted!....And, I grew up in Southern California!

The atmosphere is nice, and the staff VERY friendly!

I can't wait to visit San Francisco again, so I can go to La Fonda!
author: T. G.

description:
Quick, fresh, cheap for a burrito the size of a lady's foot (weird analogy...Err I mean about 7 inches long, 3 inches wide) with a side of chips and help yourself to the very good salsa bar. It's average though because it just didnt taste like much beyond olive oil. Which is delicious.why did it taste like evoo? They must cook their default rice in it to keep the vegans happy (that's pronounced "vedge-uhns") 
That may also be my fault because I only had the veggie burrito with pinto beans rice guac cheese crema and lettuce. It was only $5.70! That's a deal when in SF.
author: Libra J.

description:
[M]ona: 4 Stars
[W]ayne: 3 Stars
Average: 3.5 Stars

+ Big portions
+ Super Filling
+ Accepts Credit Cards
+ Coupons

- Super tiny bathroom

[M] I've been here a couple of times but my most recent visit was with Wayne and my buddy Kylie L. La Fonda is a cozy restaurant but with not many tables and seatings available. Fortunately, there are 2 floors. You can choose to either sit on the upper level and enjoy the view on how they prepare your meal from above, sit on the main level which you will most likely be bumping elbows with one another, or the outdoor seatings where you can enjoy the sun a little bit. We usually sit on the upper floor.

I love the burritos here. They come in large portions that is made big enough 2 people to share. I decided to get my own this time and ordered my usual Azteca Burrito. It is an enormous wet burrito which includes meat, rice, guacamole, sour cream, beans (I usually hold off on that), and fresh salsa, You also get tortilla chips on the side with your choice of salsa, and jalapeño peppers. Wayne had something similar to mine except it didn't have the sauce on top. Both burritos were very satisfying and flavorful. 

[W] The pork in my burrito was a bit on the dry side.

[M] I also had a horchata drink which comes in 3 flavors: watermelon, lime, and cinnamon. The cinnamon is my favorite and I have to order it every time. Kylie on the other hand likes their fruity ones like watermelon. Other than horchatas, they also have Mexican soda here too! Wayne tried the orange flavored one and it just tasted like normal orange soda to me...

Big Portions + big flavor = 4 stars. We will be back again!
author: Mona C.

description:
I had food here yesterday and the food was ok.

I decided to eat here again today, but what a mistake that was. The service (a girl named "Laura") was extremely rude. I've never experienced anything like it. I decided to leave without placing an order and she was happy with the outcome.

I went to the shawarma-place on the opposite side of the road, where I was welcomed with a big smile. What a difference.

Maybe this is her way of punishing her employer?

In either case: I'm never coming back.

Who knows what they'll do to their customers.
author: Peter T.

description: Tasty empanadas and fajita. A walk in taqueria as there is very little street parking availabe on Irving Street near Golden Gate Park 9th Ave. Few tables so recommend coming during non-rush lunch hours 230-230pm.
author: Clifford W.

description:
Blandest burrito ever.

Imagine a present day rest home and the residents are gearing up for a rowdy burrito night. They tremble in anticipation -  or meds - or any number of maladies as they are wheeled into the dining hall. The al pastor burritos come out completely void of any spice and the pork itself is a boring shade of gray. After the first bite the rest of the meal goes down mechanically - no joy, but just as a means of getting sustenance. Plates go back more than half full and even the salsa bar cannot save them.

The end. 

I am not in a rest home yet, but that is what went through my mind during lunch today. Expectations were fairly low, the staff was nice and friendly, the place clean, but I will not be back.
author: Easwud C.

description:
I dunno how this place has so many stars.. 

Before moving to the city I just assumed all food in sf had to be at least decent. But this place is expensive (for mexican food) and definitely below average. 

My friend and I got a burrito here and I think any other mexican food would taste better and be better priced.
author: Devin B.

description: Decent burrito. I recommend the broccoli. Seems fresh. Great salsa bar. OK service.
author: Grey Z.

description:
Terrible food and extremely bad service. They gave me wrong food and when I complained, instead of offering to correct it, they made faces. 
If order the steak fajitas or any other, it will be full of rice and beans and couple of small pieces of meat.
author: George S.

description: Really awesome al pastor burrito.  I actually am disappointed I didn't find this place sooner as I've had to resort to Gordo's Greed shack (charging for chips??) complete with mediocre food and crappy attitudes at any of their locations.   Convenient burrito places are kind of hard to come buy in the Sunset , especially as you get into the outer - so it's good to have options.  Maybe the super burrito here might be a bit pricier but you'll get chips with it, a burrito that is memorable, and little to no attitude from the employees.
author: Fritz S.

description:
The food here is extremely mediocre.  It's hard not to be a snob about Mexican dishes in California.  So like I said; mediocre.  

The service is prompt, and the staff are friendly.  I shall return, and you will get off Yelp and go NOW!
author: Jonathan B.

description: Mediocre Mexican food.  Nothing worth coming back for.  Price is irvingesque.  Had the camarones tacos for $3.80.  Dem Wer purty small shrimps.  Worth $2.00 instead... I wouldn't come back unless uber hungry for Mexican.  Sorry but Gordos is just as average.
author: Joel M.

description: Ordered two super burritos with steak and a super nacho with al pastor (bbq pork). Everything is lacking flavor...we ordered the dishes mild, but they don't even taste hot at all. We had to drown our food with the salsa to at least make it taste spicy. The person that made my nachos forgot to include the meat, so I went back and complained. The lady at the register called for the person who made the nachos but her shift ended and she was going out the door and didn't bother to reply to her question. So instead of trusting me about this issue the lady asks some other person to get approval to add the meat. Look at the plate of nachos! There was no meat on it at all and I ordered the items less than 5 minutes ago. Do they think I ate all the meat with the sauce and went back to lie about receiving the meat?! Instead of apologizing the lady blames the employee that made it and scoops some, lukewarm pre-cooked meat from a bucket. This is going to be the last time my friends and I go back to this place. This is the worst experience and the food is definitely not worth the price. It doesn't even match the quality of...Chipotle. Stay away from this place! They don't appreciate your business, and the food lacks flavor and everything is overpriced.
author: Mike W.

description:
I am going to miss this place.  Just moved out of my place around the corner from here but made sure that my last meal as a resident of the area was from here...helped that I was buying lunch for my movers and wanted something fast and cheap.

It's tasty Mexican food in an unpretentious setting, what more do you want?  This is probably the only place in that neighborhood (which is chock full of great restaurants) that I ate at every week.  Enough said.
author: Alan S.

description: My friend and I go here after yoga almost every time. Yeah, it might defeat the purpose, but who cares when you're eating a really delicious fresh super burrito? It might not be in the Mission, but it's still epic.
author: Matt L.

description: The only thing scarier than a Richmond burrito is a Sunset burrito... As divorced from US-Mex cuisine as Panda Express from Chinese food. I came in with low expectations and even those weren't met. Ordered a burrito al pastor and ended up with something 75% rice 25% sweet citrusy mess. Pineapple? Orange juice? Whatever was used to marinade the pork was very overused. Of course, zero char, zero meat flavor. At least the pork wasn't rock hard/paper dry. The only reason why I won't give it one star is that the food still isn't as bad as Chipotle.
author: Perci N.

description: I love their broccoli burrito and their salsa bar. Very tasty, very filling, very cool!
author: Veg V.

description:
So many mexican places in SF but La Fonda is the place you gotta try.
Best thing to do : order a super burritto and go have a beer to the bar next door which allows you to bring your food in.

//La Fonda est le restaurant mexicain à essayer à SF.
Bon plan : commandez un super burritto et mangez le au bar d'à côté où ils autorisent les plats à emporter.
author: Mark B.

description: My new favorite! I am glad I walked off 9th Ave and found this gem less than a block down Irving. The burritos and tacos are very reasonably priced and taste great. The women at the counter are nice and friendly and always offer free chips & cups for the salsa bar. The dining area downstairs is very small but they have an upstairs as well. There have always been people eating here, but it has never been packed and I have never had to wait more than 5 minutes to get my order. The food is fresh and made to order. 5 stars all around!
author: Venus S.

description: Food was mushy. Salsa was all gone. Service was crap. Attitude much? I'm still on a hunt for a good Mexican place.
author: Wendy C.

description: I eat here pretty often, always ordering the same type of taco, yet the cashier Laura never remembers me.  I don't come for the service ~ it's inexpensive, fresh and good.  if you don't like Laura, do to Tart to Tart ( which has a Mexican section now and very nice people!)
author: Kay C.

description:
While the inside is very clean, the menu is creative and varied, and the workers are really patient with picky customers...I REALLY do not recommend the food.

The Carne Asada Steak in my burrito was SO bland. It was like eating cardboard. It was like an adventure trying to excavate the tiny pieces of steak hidden in my burrito, except you aren't victorious in the end. The orange rice was really soggy and sweet (??), the "guacamole" was absolute watered down crap (and they charge $1.80 for 2 ounces of it. wtf), the sour cream looked and tasted off.

Free chips which were crunchy and fresh, but the three salsas at the salsa bar tasted funky to me. 

WHACK
author: Jessica C.

description: I've been coming here to buy food for the last two Thursday evenings, and the same woman at the counter has been taking my order. She has been very rude to me for no good reason, and she acts like she doesn't want me in the restaurant. She's a Latina with her foot right up her but in other words. And I'm not coming back here anymore because of her. Thank god this isn't the best burrito place in town. I guess I'll go back to Gordo Taqueria around the corner where the people are friendly. I'm sure she'd like that very much.
author: Alex W.

description: I ate here yesterday.  About 30 minutes later I started feeling bloated.  2 hours later I started getting a stomach ache.  What ensued was one of the worst nights of my life.  After vomiting every 30 minutes from midnight through 6 am, then every hour until noon, followed by every 2 hours until 4 pm I am now physically and mentally exhausted.  It was *definitely* the cochinita de pibil (or possibly the accompanying sour-cream-like sauce).  100% certain of that.  Anyhow, my body is wrecked, I had to miss a day of work, and I'm still feeling sick to the point where all I can keep down is tea.  I did not tip at the time because I never tip for counter service, unless the food is excellent and prepared quickly (neither was the case).  After reading on Yelp how at least one regular customer seems to think that the service/quality is related to the tip I'm not surprised, for all I know my meal was prepared by Typhoid Mary.
author: Charles W.

description:
Their Super Tacos really are super; I couldn't even fold it, they were so packed (with rice, beans, salsa, guacamole, and sour cream)!

One Super Taco and one Regular Taco (meat+salsa) was the perfect meal. Maybe not for a football player but I'm 5'5 and 120lbs., it was perfect for me!

They offer complimentary chips with your order, salsa and water is self-served. Three types of salsa, I have no idea what kinds but one is green.

They offer seating downstairs and upstairs; downstairs offer a few tables and also tall tables with bar stools for a quick solo meal.

I had a regular chorizo taco and a super pollo taco-- YUM.

Last but not least-- staff, nice. You'll hear their chatter in Spanish while you eat. Nice folks and they move fast! I had paid, turned around to put things down on one of the tall tables and as soon as I turned back around my tacos were plated, plattered, and ready for me to inhale-- I was starving. Perfect place to go if you're starving, it was so fast!
