description: Good, cheap, and filling. You can eat for under $10. You can get breakfast for dinner here, just order off of the eggs menu. There is a cute little seating area upstairs. The salsa bar has one type of chunky salsa that tastes like it has tomatoes and cooked onions in it (slightly sweet, also spicy) which I liked alot. The place was colorful, not too noisy, definitely not chic. You bus your own meal on a plastic tray. Kinda like a school cafeteria.
author: John S.

description:
You know, this place isn't that bad. The little loft is cute. But I don't know, I just feel like I was over charged for the the quality of food I got. Don't get me wrong, it was good, but our order came to almost $20 for a quesadilla, burrito, and spanish rice, and it was more of a fast-food sit down restaurant. One plus is that they serve different kinds of meat (ex. three different types of chicken). That was awesome. 

I wouldn't really travel out of my way to come to this place though.
author: Catherine H.

description:
Every neighborhood needs selection, especially the Inner Sunset.  You have a great selection of bars and cafes, novelty shops, and even bakeries.  Until La Fonda arrived, you had one choice: Gordo's.  Now don't get me wrong, Gordo's is tasty.  I had been going there since high school.  I was partial to it, I admit.  Then one evening after a few drinks at Yancy's, me and my friend realized we were in the mood for a burrito, but didn't want to walk those one and half blocks to Gordo's.  And so we discovered La Fonda.

The selection of meats and tortillas is much better here.  All the meats have more flavor, and even without the spicy salsa, you can feel the burn, if that is what you're into (which I am).  

The staff are super friendly, and are happy to tweak your burrito in anyway.  There is always seating, either upstairs or downstairs.  They also have a great selection of fresh salsas and jalapenos.  It's like a salsa bar, actually.    

This is the place to go if you happen to be outside of the Mission and are craving the tasty goodness.
author: Adam E.

description:
When you're craving Mexican food and in the Inner Sunset, you basically have two options: La Fonda or Gordos. There are die-hard fans of both. Personally, I don't think either are as good as the places you'll find in the Mission. But hey, that's across town and sometimes us Sunset-dwellers get burrito cravings but don't have time to hoof it over there. 

So which to go to? I'm a La Fonda fan... it seems less authentic than Gordos, but in a healthier way. This is the type of place where you can choose your tortilla (spinach, sun-dried tomato, etc...) But the quality of the ingredients is better, and you can still get out of there for very little money. When I'm feeling indulgent, I ask them to add shrimp to a steak super burrito. Mmmmm. 

My favorite burrito in the city though is still the super veggie at Tacqueria Cancun. The fresh chunks of avocado area sooo good there.
author: Shoshana D.

description:
Burritos burritos burritos oh my.  Yummy variety, tofu ranchero, meat, beans and cheese.  They roll 'em up fast and they roll 'em up good.  The line moves at lightning pace until you've dropped 5 bucks on a kickass meat-filled tortilla cylinder.  
The nachos my friend got were average.  All others (4 in total) in my party (it WAS quite the party actually) raved over their respective tubes o' goodness.  
How many Mexican spots are there in the Inner Sunset?  I don't know, I just moved here, but they'll have to cook it up pretty BUENO to beat La Fonda.
author: Eric S.

description: Worst Mexican food that I've eaten. I ordered a cuban torta and while the cook is making it I notice a red sausage or something like that. Once I received my food, I found that it was extremly big. I took a bite out of the torta and oh man what a nasty taste. The meat is supposed to be very thin, mine was really thick and chewy. A few more things that I did not like was the cheese they used. It's supposed to be mexican cheese not chedder. Taking a closer look at the sandwich i noticed the "red sausage" and took a bite of it, it was a damn hotdog frank, I've never eaten a cuban torta with a hotdog frank in it. My partner ordered a quesadilla and it was also the worst tasting quesadilla EVER.... We should of kept the original place we were going too "Gordos" instead of this disgusting place. Plus most of the food is re microwaved. I also went to grab some more soda and they wanted to charge 1.00 for refill when they already charge 1.75 for a medium cup. I was going to pay 1.00 for the refill and they advised me they cannot take credit card for under 5.00. I didn't have any cash on me either. What a cheap ass the owner is. OK, thats it. :P
author: Luis L.

description:
So I read on Yelp that this place wasn't too bad and decided to try it last Friday evening! I decided to try it instead of going with my usual Gordo's order. I went in, ordered the Super Nachos and a Corona, and then was told my bill was over $13. As I was paying it, I realized that was pretty steep, considering the nachos were a little over $6 and the beer was $3. I asked the woman why it was so expensive and she looked at me like I was a cheapskate. Another man came over and gave me the same look. Finally they called the person who I assume was the manager over, and he printed the receipt and looked at me like I was crazy. As I took a look at the receipt I realized the woman charged me for two beers. The manager refunded my money, but acted as though I didn't fairly deserve it. The first back thing to happen in the place.

Then my food was horrible. The beans were bad. The chicken gross. They heated up the sour cream. The guacamole was disgusting. The only redeeming factor was my beer. I would not recommend going to this place! Go around the corner to Gordos were the food is good and they don't try and rip you off!
author: Rebecca D.

description: A fortunate find in the Sunset...great Mexican food at unbeatable prices.  We had the mollettes, a sandwich of chorizo, on a large roll with melted cheese and pico de gallo with refried beans on the side---for $3.20!  Great chips and a decent salsa bar.
author: Joc V.

description: I wandering into La Fonda on a bank run.  Sat down with some of their chips and a super burrito.  Fairly ordinary burrito, but I really enjoyed the salsa bar with the bowl of warm chips they gave me.  Next time, more chips, less burrito!
author: Bill H.

description: I have been going to La Fonda for years, since high school. I am 28 at the end of the month. I always recommended their food to friends and out-of-towners, sometimes even took my clients for a quick lunch there. Today when i walked in, i order a usual super carne asada burrito. Four more people filed in after i ordered... probably 5 minutes after, all four were served, i sat down patiently for about 25 minutes then i noticed a man who literally came in 5 minutes ago, received his wet burrito,  ( during this time, another man told them he was lactose and tolerant so asked them to not put cheese and sour cream and had them remake his burrito, this same man received his burrito while i already payed and was waiting about 10 minutes) i walked up, noticed, and asked "you haven't even started on my burrito have you?) In which they replied give us 2 minutes, after two minutes they gave another person the same order, another wet burrito, i demanded my money back, and returned the coka cola. I will never again eat-out at this place, they just lost A LOT of my business.
author: Mikhail S.

description:
YES!  Finally, a burrito oasis in the inner sunset!
I've had the Chicken Tinga, Cochinita Pibil, Carne Asada, and Pollo Asado.  And I must say, they are all quite awesome.  The Cochinita is not a common taco/burrito meat around, and is quite tasty stewed pork, marinated with agave, banana leaf, and some other stuff I can't remember.  The Carne Asada is seared on the griddle just before wrapping, and is quite flavorful.  The Pollo Asado is VERY well marinated and grilled.  Very tasty!  They melt their cheese when they steam the tortilla, and you get to choose between white, wheat, spinach, and tomato tortillas.  Free chips and salsa as usual, and their pico has some nice roasted tomatoes or chipotle action going on.  Very spicy...just how I like it.  Good salsa verde too.

Owner/manager is nice and friendly.  and gives you lots of chips... more than I want tempting me, but still, he's generous.

If it were ~$5 a burrito, I would give this place 5 stars.  But it's ~$6.50 inc tax, so I have to give it 4 stars.
author: Fong L.

description: Good tacos for being in the Sunset.  Filetito asado was tender and tasty.  Al pastor was sweet - I'm not use to pineapples in tacos.
author: Elsie D.

description:
They deserve 2 stars for cleanliness, friendliness, tortilla selection, and acceptance of credit cards (a rarity among SF burrito places).

When it comes to the actual food, however, La Fonda doesn't deliver the goods.  Bland describes it best, followed by inauthentic.  The meat lacks flavor and the rice is dotted with--wtf?!--peas and carrots.  While the burritos are cheap and generously proportioned, they just don't taste very good.

I've given this spot a few chances but, I won't be back.  There's too much good Mexican food elsewhere.
author: Karin H.

description:
HORRIBLE  i been here twice. ..
FIRST TIME:  so so...

SECOND TIME: i went with 2 people, they forgot the WHIP CREAM in our burritos!!!  and the nachos with disgusting!!!  

I like Mexican food, but i rather sell my soul and go to some "franchisee" place like Rubios and Baja Fresh than eat crappppy food from this place.
author: Mike L.

description:
I was reading reviews for the Gordo's nearby and I took fellow Yelper's advice. They said La Fonda's was much better. 

The staff were not so polite and nice like how yall described them as. Maybe because I was younger than their usual costumers, don't discriminate. Sheesh. I did not get any thank you or you're welcome during my whole time here. They talk really loud, having their own conversation about who knows what. 

I ordered enchiladas and my friend ordered steak quesilladas and strawberry aguas fresca. The enchiladas were ok, not what I expected. It wasn't that wet and smooth, but whatever. My friend's  aguas fresca was disappointing. The melon aguas fresca at Ocean Taqueria are much better. I would not come back again.

The two stars are for their cleanliness and salsa bar.
author: Winnie L.

description:
la fonda wasn't great nor bad.

the have a small salsa bar, but no pickled carrots?

the burrito was plentiful, and it wasn't too pricy... but i feel as thought there weren't as many flavors as there should have been (to be a 4-5 star establishment).

if you're in the area, hit it up. you always want to have burrito joint tick marks on your belt, and it's not bad.
author: Ameer N.

description: Pretty good. It is quick, and their selection of Fresh salsa is nice. I seem to get lunch here pretty often.
author: Kris J.

description:
Usually I try to avoid getting mexican round my hood so I can save this delicacy for when I'm in the mission and/or with my latino bf.  dont' want to over dosed on it, okay?  But when i'm home and i'm craving something tasty, filling, fresh and affordable, there's no other place than La Fonda.  I just know it.  Larry knows it.  there's no second guessing, La Fonda fits the bill.

Love, love, love the super taco.  For $3.60 (I think) I can get a mound of goodness that fills me up.  rice, beans, cochinita pibil, guac, cheese and sour cream topped with cilantro=delicious.  their salsas are freshly delicious too.  

The super chicken mole burrito and was not to disappoint either.  A bigger meal for a bigger appetite.  Yum.  Go larry!
author: Elle N.

description:
Today, I had a late lunch with my boyfriend and best friend at La Fonda. Over lunch, we pondered why "American" food in any place but America does not taste so sweet. Finally, the conversation rolled around to what people are looking for when they eat "American" food in, say, France, or England, or wherever.
Then, we thought of La Fonda. We're pretty sure this isn't what a Mexican eats in Mexico (though it may have some/many of the same ingredients,) and we're pretty sure that we don't think it's "proper Mexican (with a capital 'M') food," but we do think it's delicious.
It hits the carby, proteiny, dairy, cheap, delicious spot. Honestly! For $5.90, I get more food than I can scarf down, and it tastes great! Nicely prepared, everything I want when I am looking for "Mexican" food, not Mexican food. Do you catch my drift?
author: Colleen M.

description:
I dont hate this place, i just think there are better places...I'd only go here if i had a intense craving for mexican, and had no other place to eat in the area.....I had the Salmon burrito which was interesting... i mean it was flavorful but it wasnt amazing....it was probably just shy of good, so it was pretty good, but its not somewhere id bring someone i cared about...

i dont mean to bad mouth them, but i am just not a fan...downright sucks compared to la corneta or ocean taqueria
author: Calvinn W.

description: I went to La Fonda on empty.  I ordered a chicken burrito with black beans, spicy salsa on a wheat tortilla.  I love that you have the option to choose a tortilla.  I ordered to go and was very very satisfied by both portion and flavor.  The salsa bar was flavorful and delicious. I will for sure be visiting again soon.
author: Andrew Christian C.

description:
I really, really want to like this place. I tried it tonight for the third time and again came away disappointed. The corn tortillas of my enchilada were dry and crunchy around the edges, the tortilla chips somewhat stale and chewy. The chicken was ok, as were the beans and rice. Maybe it's just been too hot and their product is getting older faster than expected?? 

And - the woman ringing the sale has the prices memorized plus tax so beware if you're paying cash. She failed to ring up my cash sale, so I didn't tip given that she'd already gotten $9.58 out of me. Just to be sure I waited around to see if she would ring it up, but no, next customer in paid with a credit card, which of course she had to ring up. So pay by cc when visiting this place to ensure the owner is getting his or her fair due.
author: sherri s.

description:
Ok, I admit that I turned my nose up at the thought of a different Mexican restaurant residing in the place where my beloved Pancho's one stood.  So I walked by it for a good 6 months or so with out ever stepping foot inside.  Then one of my roommates dragged me inside and demanded I try their nachos.  

She is EVIL I tell you EVIL.

So good.  So very awesomely good.  The azteca nachos are so fricken good I eat the whole damn order by myself. Plus they have the best lime fresca I"ve had in awhile!  Annnnd you can buy a half pint of their mild salsa (the yummy pico de guio kind).  

I admit I haven't really tried anything else due to my strange need to just stick with one dish per restaurant (I'm a freak, I know).  But I'm trying to adventure out.  The next time (aka tonight) I go to La Fonda's I want to try a taco or burrito or SOME thing different.  I've heard good things from all of my roommates so I'm ready to step outside my boundaries!

Clearly I take food way to seriously....
author: Heather H.

description:
I was so bummed this wasn't that good.  I LOVE mex.  

The enchilada sauce was sweet.  I had to drench it in hot sauce.  The nachos were just okay.  The taco with filet was just okay.  At least the refried beans were good.  

Service is wonderful but DAMN I want some good mex food!!  If anyone can tell me of one remotely close to Inner Sunset, please do.  Thanks.
author: Staci M.

description:
This is just so freaking awesome to have right around the corner from my house... nice to not have to go over to the mission on a lazy Sunday for some Mexican. 

Great salsa bar, pickled jalapeos 
Quick pretty authentic food
All the meat choices you can think of... and some you dont want to... 

Luckily I was able to visit with my little brother from Southern California... and both he and I have fairly established taste in the realm of taquerias and salsa bars... and both walked away not only full, but impressed with the selection and execution.
author: Jordan Y.

description:
La Fonda is my go-to burrito place. Their food is as good as it gets for a burrito shop and the staff is incredibly sweet.

It isn't easy to find burrito shops that offer sliced avocado, which I prefer over guacamole (my girlfriend wants me to mention that their guac is amazing). I usually go with a bean, rice, cheese and sliced avocado burrito on a whole wheat tortilla. Heaven is the next 15-20 minutes.

Forget Gordo's. La Fonda blows them away with better ingredients, better selection and better service.
author: Todd M.

description: This place makes some seriously fresh and tastey Mexican dishes!
author: hayley t.

description:
Very Nice place!  What impresses me most?  How Friendly they are!  Most burrito places just don't smile or act friendly to you...but here, what I feel like a customer!

Burritos are cheap and done well.  Only 4 because they do not grill the tortilla.  Still, it is now the best in the sunset!
author: Sir Paul L.

description: This restaurant is pretty close to where I live and one of the better places to grab a burrito. The ingredients are fresh, the service is fast and the prices are pretty cheap. I also love that they have a good selection of salsas, something that's needed in a Mexican restaurant.
author: Terry K.

description:
This is the best taco joint in the Inner Sunset. 
I eat there once a month.
Try a chicken burrito drowning in mole sauce.
author: Joe C.

description: Good mexican food close to home. I really like the empanadas and the chicken torta. Generous portions. They charge for guacamole which at this point is to be expected but a bummer nevertheless.
author: Katrice S.

description: i wanted to try something different i mean other then gordos, the burrito was good nothing special... but i'll come back and give it another try, it's really hard to get parking so be prep. lolz
author: jonathan h.

description: You can basically make your own burrito as big as your head.  First you pick the style, then the wrap and finally the meat.  Within 5 you are good to go.  Go to the salsa and pickle bar.  Great price!
author: Megan P.

description:
This was the WORST burrito I ever had.  The guacamole tasted like face scrub, and their secret ingredient is obviously water, because my burrito was sloppy and wet.

Barf.
author: Andy G.

description: I have been on a hunt for sopes in the city since I moved here, and must say La Fonda's were quite tasty. Tasted very fresh and hand made, and the salsas were good as well. If you need a quick, tasty mexican dish on Irving, I would definitely go here.
author: Clay T.

description: Best chips in town!  Yummy and good-sized veggie taco for $2.80.  Friendly service; tip them well!
author: George K.

description: The Miraloma and Ocean taquerias have proven that west-siders can enjoy quality burritos without an obligatory pilgrimage to the Mission.  So you'd think that Inner Sunset, the mecca of the eclectic palate, would have a great offering as well (beyond Gordo, which is a chain).  I was hoping La Fonda would be that place, but, while the balcony seating is fun and all, the food just doesn't go for broke like a classic taqueria must.  And the portions are pretty skimpy.  Granted, we had the chicken fajitas, and to be fair you really must judge Mexican on the burrito standard (or, if you're really anal, the carnitas burrito standard).  I'd like to try some of the more interesting meat types like Tinga or Azteca before I really pass judgment...but with all the delicious smells in the Inner Sunset, it's sort of hard to follow your nose back to a place like La Fonda, if you know what I mean.
author: Wes M.

description: overall a pretty solid place, but I have to admit i come here for the two-for one burrito deal. i was raised on southern california's version of burritos, and SF's style cannot compete with. But not bad for sf burritos.
author: Katie S.

description: I haven't been here in years, but I remember their burritos were good! I like how the place has a lot of room to sit. I believe there is a upstairs where you can dine. Pretty neat! This reminds me... I should come back for a burrito sometime soon!
author: Edgar G.

description: If you can help it, venture outside the Inner Sunset for mexican food. But if you can't, La Fonda will probably do. I got the super veggie burrito which was fine, nothing spectacular but not terrible either. On the plus side, it was super cheap
author: Aubree S.

description: Good prices, good food and friendly service.  Also, the burritos are HUGE!!!  Definitely more than enough for one person, that or you'll start having to buy larger jeans.  Awesome.  Although I do have to admit that every time I hear the name of this place I think of Napoleon Dynamite.
author: Kate B.

description: I  do like the La Fonda, not only because it was the girlfriend's name in Napoleon Dynamite, but also the staff is really really sweet.  The burritos are big and juicy, my biggest problem is that they put lettuce in them.  I luckily remembered to have them leave it out the last time I dined there, however, if you forget, the re-heating of you second half, also known as dinner #2 gets a little weird w/ hot lettuce.  They also have my new #1 criterion for a rocking burrito place, salsa bar.  This is a good one too, nice spicy salsas and a big fresh bowl of cilantro with my name all over it!
author: Brye L.

description: Dammit, they raised their prices...The portion size and flavor of the veggie burrito is good...but what was really their draw before was a decent burrito at a good price.
author: Liza W.

description: Really like the tofu taco. Tasty and healthy, i.e. not oily or salty. Mmmm.... getting hungry just thinking about it...
author: Yvonne C.

description: I am a semi fan of this place.  I'm not a huge Gordo fan and L'Avendia is not on my top ten either.The tofu burrito gets a thumbs up from my veggie roomie who doesn't eat tofu!  The Cochinita Pibil is good and I highly recommend it.  They have a Spicy Chicken Burrito too...mmm...yummy.  It's only two blocks away from my house!!  The owner is super nice, too.
author: Jay H.

description: I went there last night with a friend and ordered the Super Veggie burrito and the cinnamon horchata.  This order came with complementary chips and salsa.  The burrito was decent but everything had the same texture so it tasted kind of mushy.  The portion was great though and I saved 1/2 for lunch the next day.  The horchata, however, was amazing and not too sweet which is my pet peeve!  Yum!! Definitely a must order.  The chips and salsa were definitely disappointing.  The chips were not really good at all and there were only like 3 salsa options, each of which was really watery.  The tomatillo salsa was good but I tend to like salsas that are on the more chunky side.  I'd definitely come back because the price is good and the staff is nice, but its not a place that I would go out of my way to go eat at.
author: Andrea F.

description: Twice I've ordered the Azteca burrito, no beans and no guacamole (allergy) and twice when I get it home it has guacamole on it so twice they've offered me a store credit. However, once bitten, twice shy so just try PAYING ATTENTION and keep the credit.
author: Nikke G.

description: Met up with some friends to grab dinner here prior to trivia night in the neighborhood. The entire menu looked great but I ended up going with the Veggie Burritto which consists of beans (you choose b/w refried, black, and pinto - I went with refried, yum!), rice (spanish rice! not nasty white steamed rice like Chipotle), salsa, and cheese. I asked them to add guacamole into the burrito. It was delicious! Unlike a lot of burrito places, the portion size was filling, yet manageable. I tried out the milder side salsa as well as the salsa verde and both were delicious - the verde was a bit spicier than the red salsa I got. They also give you a side of tortilla chips with your meal. Definitely worth a try and satisfied a recent craving I've been having for some quality mexican food.
author: Megan B.

description: You can't beat the prices.  The corn tortillas are tasty and there are several vegetarian options (including a decent tofu taco).  The service leaves a little something to be desired, but you can't ask for very much with a $3 taco, or a $4 huarache...  The "salsa bar" is also lacking....  stay away from the red salsas, but do try the tomatillo.  It's deliciously tart and just enough heat to lend a little bit of kick.
author: vicarious c.

description: Not sure what happened to this place but a couple years ago it was good. Just stopped in and got a pork burrito that fell apart in seconds. Ended up eating it with a fork. The pork was alright but lacking in that it was just a pile of spilled burrito ingrediants rather than an actual burrito.
author: Colin F.

description: Staff isn't very friendly even though I'm always really nice and tip. Sad face. They seemed to get a little friendlier when they realized I spoke Spanish, though. Annoying. But they do have those little mini tacos that you get on taco trucks. Not as good, but they CAN suppress my cravings for a little while when I can't make it downtown.
author: Melissa C.

description: I love the Aztec burrito. It's big, messy, and hit you in all the write places. If you're not going to get that, then I recommend going to Gordo a block away because everything else seem a little overprice.
author: Nam T.

description: This is the most cursed taco shop in all of  San Francisco.  That's why it gets 4 orange stars.  There is bad juju on this spot because a restaurant starts and closes up here almost every month.   I think this used to be an old Indian tomb or DMV or something.  Then it was an Italian place.  Then it was a California place.  Apparently the spirits are happy with this taco/burrito place.  It's clean, nicely painted and the tacos are good.  They also have good mole.  It's always nice to see the little touches that make these places stand out.  Here it's the cochinita pibil (pork with spicy sauce).  My buddy from South Dakota likes it, only because he likes to say "cochinita pibil"  over and over, along with "horchata."
author: ed y.

description: Eat here at least once/wk. Neighborhood favorite b/c it's cheap, tastes good (for nocal), and the service is friendly and quick. Typically get a super veggie burrito on a tomato or spinach tortilla sin lechuga (avoid drippage). And a regular taco. I'd recommend over Gordo's and L'Avenida, both of which I've been to a number of times.
author: Ben L.

description: I usually don't come here because I've had bad experiences in the past.  Tonight that has been confirmed.  They messed up my to go order, but I'm ok with that, they forgot guacamole.  I figured it out when I got home and promptly went back.  They looked uninterested and gave me a tiny side of guac.  I asked for a little more and they wanted to charge me $1.50.  I couldn't believe it, awful customer service with no apology.  This is why my business goes to Gordo's.
author: Jesse S.

description: La Fonda is pretty good. Look for the coupons to get a two for one in the monthly "value pack" that arrives in the mail.
author: Jonathan F.

description: It's pretty obvious from the minute you walk into this place that it's not going to be authentic, so you can't really knock it for that. It's too clean, and they were playing Modest Mouse. The tofu taco is pretty tasty even though it is way too full and soggy to pick up. I've also had the veggie super burrito which was just ok. Not too bad for the sunset.
author: Jessica S.

description: Cheap, fast and delicious! I love the tacos and the salsa bar.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Not the best burrito places you will meat. They aren't that big, but are not that bad. I would have loved the place more if they had hot sauce bottles around on tables or if they tin foiled their burritos. It would have made it easier to hold since I would rather prefer to eat it while holding it rather than using forks or knives.
author: Sonlay V.

description: I think La Fonda has finally broken the curse of 712 Irving St.  Over the past 4 years there have been at least 3 previous restaurants that have had to shut down, but La Fonda keeps going.  The Azteca burrito will satisfy even the heartiest appetite.  The corn quesadilla with beans/rice extra is a full Mexican meal for only $4.29...you just can't beat that!
author: Kelan T.

description: I've been here on 4 different occasions and ordered a different dish each time.  And every time I was completely disappointed.  The food was greasier than the average Mexican food, and it didn't even taste that good...not worth it. Go to Gordo's around the block instead. They are fast, pleasant, and best of all, all of their food is delicious!!!
author: Rosie S.

description: I see everybody here talking about the tacos and burritos, which are decent enough (esp. for the Sunset) with fresh ingredients, but y'all gringos are missing out on the other half of the menu. Seriously, has nobody else tried the alambre? Try the alambre, motherfuckers!!!
author: Sarang D.

description: I do love enchiladas.   Particularly with mole.  The chicken was a little tough, but it might have been because they were take away and had to be taken away and carried for a bit.  The salsa is pretty good, if a bit watery, but REALLY I JUST LOVE ENCHILADAS.
author: diana s.

description:
cochinita pibil plate.  good stuff.  
i like the feel of this place, and that it's open til 10.  

do it.
author: aaron p.

description: First, what's the point of posting a menu if the prices are rediculously out of sync with reality. The restaurant curiously has no printed menus to take for reference.  The currently posted online menus (at allmenus,com and campusfood.com) I could find both listed a regular burrito at $4.95 yet in reality they're 26% more than that - $6.25.  And as far as the quality of the food, I continue to be seriously curious how anybody can rate this place as good!  This time I tried their chicken mole and have to say it was a laughable attempt at this dish.  Saying the flavor was one-dimensional would be a overly generous.  So, I'll try to remember to read my own reviews next time I get desperate for Mexican in my neighborhood and avoid this place.  After a few tries over a number of years I can say with confidence that they are a sad excuse for Mexican food.
author: j d.

description: Good prices and good food.  So far it's been better than L'Avenida up the street.  La Fonda is not as good as the burrito places of the Mission, but since we can walk there it gets and extra star.
author: Jeffrey F.

description: Big fan of the beef super burrito and the chicken super tacos. The salsa is pretty good and the staff is friendly. This place is really close to my house so it is my usual spot for fast Mexican. However, be warned that the Mexican sandwich is not for to-go. By the time I got it home the bread was a soggy mess. Ew. Another time I ordered fajitas to-go and they forgot my tortillas! I had some extras in the fridge so it wasn't that big of a disaster, but it was a little disheartening. Despite these two minor setbacks, I really enjoy La Fonda.
author: Juls M.

description: Not bad. A little light on the non-meats variety, but that's not their focus. Love the name... It reminds me of Napoleon Dynamite's brother's girlfriend. So they get a plus star for that alone!
author: Laura B.

description:
it's easy to walk by and not even notice the newest mexican restaurant in the inner sunset with all the construction going on, but after one bite of this heaven in a tortilla, all i could think was "WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN ALL MY LIFE?!" i love their azteca burrito (rice, beans, meat topped with enchilada sauce, sour cream, guac, salsa and melted cheese) with the cochinita pibil pork with a hint of banana leaf. this place beats l'avenida any day, but that's another story. i'm just happy i don't have to go all the way to the mission to get a decent burrito.

update: i went here again and had their flautas. i think the chefs had no idea what they were doing and were probably not the regular chefs because i watched one of them trying to fry an egg. she ended up throwing away like 10!!! also their salsa is watered down! what happened?!!! the last experience was not tasty so i had to take away two stars. DEMOTED!
author: Tin-Tin E.

description: Today, me and the bf decided to go to Irving St. & spontaneously pick a restaurant to eat at.  It was between CrepeVine & La Fonda, so we went with this one.  We both got shrimp super burritos for $7 bucks! Pretty good prices considering most taquerias charge extra for seafood. The burrito: huge, although I didn't like how they didn't come wrapped in foil which is how I'm used to eating one. The shrimp was really fresh, rice had peas & carrots in it, which was unusual to me. Now, I know that burritos aren't authentic Mexican but I felt like I was eating at Chevy's or something. Pluses: Unlike Taqueria's let's say in the Mission, the food wasn't as heavy.  Ooh & their fresh strawberry juice was the besssst! Overall, food was ok, prices were reasonable,  just a new place to try out.
author: Kristine R.

description: This spot gets one extra star for being in the Inner Sunset.  When I lived there it was great to have an alternative to Gordo (blech).  If you get a burrito, make sure you get the flour tortilla.  The others don't soften up and makes the burrito somewhat chewy.
author: Paul W.

description: Yummy burritos and tacos.   I make a habit of every burrito place I go that I get a carne asada on my first time there.  It is my favorite meat and it makes for good comparison.  This place scores high on that count.  La Fonda's burritos are good sized (either one huge lunch or I cut in half and save for a light dinner later) and good priced.  The meat is high quality, I've never noticed any gristle or yuck to it and it had lots of flavor.  I've noticed a trend towards sauce-y burritos-- not a bad thing, just that the meat/gauc/sour cream/salsa combo here makes a nice mixed up combination that soaks into the rice and tortilla a lot.   Sometimes when I get it to-go they throw chips in the bag, sometimes not.  But their thick and crispy tortilla chips are yummy so make sure to get some.
author: Shelley M.

description: Given that it's in the sunset, it's not bad. Compare the Mexican food in the mission, it doesnt' stand a chance. I had a burrito here this afternoon after reading all the Yelp reviews, and I wasn't all that impressed with it. But the food was filling and overally got the job done.
author: Srinivas R.

description: The inner sunset isn't exactly known for it's Mexican food, but this is the best that it gets in the foggy side of the city. Great homemade chips, a wide variety of salsas at the bar, and the food is cooked while you wait. I mostly grab my stuff to go while I'm on the way home from work, but if you're ever in the area, skip Gordo's and try this place out.
author: Tim T.

description: Great Mexican food in the Sunset/Irving district.  I had the Cochinita Pibil dinner plate which came with salad, beans, tortillas and chips and it reminded me of the Pibil that I had when I was in the Yucatan.  Throw in some Jamaica, and the bill was still under $10!  Fresh made salsa to boot...
author: Mark D.

description: They serve a fairly decent veggie burrito here, definitely better than Gordo in my opinion. Especially because of the tortilla chips that come with it...those are really good. I don't much like the salsa they use, so I just do without. Good service too!
author: Barbs J.

description: Not bad for a burrito joint in Sunset. Fast service. Good tasting chips and salsa. Clean atmosphere. The agua fresca es muy delicioso. Down side? Very, very poorly wrapped burrito (it doesn't stay rolled). Unfortunate, really. But still worth a try if you need a burrito fix and can't be bothered to bike, bus, or bring your booty over to the Mission.
author: Chung N.

description: The minute my eyes glanced over the menu I couldn't help repeating to my boyfriend "wow -this place is cheap". After living in Russian Hill for the past year any quick bites under $5 is a deal. For breakfast I got a huge plate of rancheros huevos and he got a breakfast burrito all for under $10. The food was fresh and delicious, and the service was quick.  Their salsas are also really good.   I will definately visit this place again.
author: Kat F.

description:
i love la fonda. it might sound ghetto-fabulous, but in actuality, it's just fabulous. it is the best place to get a burrito in the inner sunset, hands down. be warned that their burritos are big, so you need to welcome the inevitable food coma that follows.

they have really great carnitas and chicken mole that even my boyfriend (a self-described "beaner") loves. they also make the best breakfast burrito (try the chorizo and mushroom), have a variety of choices for your tortilla wrapper (spinach, sun-dried tomato, flour, wheat), have delicious agua frescas (sandia and fresa are my faves), free chips w/ the meal (which deserves a "yay!" since some burrito places make you actually pay for the chips - poo on that), beer, and a fresh salsa/pepper bar (please don't sing that quiznos rat song about pepper bars). super sweet folks work the counter and custom make your burrito exactly to your liking.
author: Veronica Y.

description: This place is sooo good and so filling. For a local sunset place, and not a neighborhood gordo's this place makes burritos covered in enchilada sauce. That is one of the best things i have ever tasted. Which reminds me I haven't visited  them in a while. Price wise not at all expensive. Quality wise....yuummmmooooo
author: yana Z.

description: I'm particular about the burritos I like, and this place was just not the right fit. Why is there lettuce in my burrito? I just don't know. It wasn't even warm. If I were to do it again, maybe a more specific order would produce a more enjoyable burrito. The pork looks tasty though.
author: Faye P.

description: Had a burrito here after Bay to Breakers. Very tasty, good salsa and reasonably priced. What more can you ask for from a burrito?!
author: Jan Michael K.

description: I'm really not a fan so far, although to be fair, i've only been here once. I ordered the Super Chicken Burrito w/ the sauce on top (forget the official name). The sauce tasted a little "off", maybe they added too much nutmeg? But the one thing that is completely in-excusable to me was the guacamole. I ordered a large side/appetizer portion, and it was completely inedible. NEVER have the bf and i left guacamole behind, but it was so watered down and tasteless that we couldn't even force ourselves to like it. Too, we didn't feel so good when we got home. I've definitely had better!
author: Sandra D.

description: I love La Fonda, the staff is nice and you get your food really fast!
author: T C.

description: So my first (and subsequently only) time dining at La Fonda was a very disappointing experience. I ordered a vegetarian burrito, and it literally tasted like nothing. It was so bland, that I had to make dinner for myself when I got home. I sparred myself the calories. Next time I will go down the street to Gordos.
author: erin s.

description: Great safe and clean Mexican food in the inner Sunset. A little more pricey than other locations in the Castro, Noe Valley or Diamond Heights but, hey, none of those places are close to this one so you deal with it.
author: Alden C.

description:
i used to live in the mission.  when i lived there i ate a lot of burritos.  then i moved to the inner sunset and i didn't eat any burritos for a while.  when i was ready to start eating burritos again i found la fonda.  it easily destroys any other burrito shop in the sunset and can even hold it down vs. some the mission's finest.  for real.  
try the chicken mole or al pastor burritos.
author: Andrew F.

description:
pro: quesadillas packed with grilled chicken and guacamole
con: spicy sauce

pro:  chicken enchilladas with verde sauce, rice and black beans
con:  spicy sauce

pro:  fresh baked chips
con: spicy sauce

pro:  great service 
con: spicy sauce
author: Grace C.

description:
They must have a beer license, but no rita's were in site.  Darn!  
I had the Paradise salad, add chicken and I was impressed!  For a salad that is :-)..it was fresh, the chicken has a smoked grill taste. I tasted my friends dishes and frankly, I'd rather go to chipotle for a burrito. It was not good.  My friend had a humungous omelette with potatoes super drenched in oil..too greasy!

I asked if requested would they make an egg white omelette. The reply was no.  That sucks.  
The chips were cold too, but they were ok.  
I would not come out of my way to come here, but if I had to I'd get the salad again!  Now I know what cojita cheese tastes like..yum!
author: Bella G.

description:
FRESH! 
+'s 
Great for vegetarians! 
Salsa bar excellent. 
Chips great. 
Burritos made with your choice of tortilla (spinach, wheat, etc.) 
Ambiance is a bright colorful mix. 

-
Not open late night!
author: Juhi D.

description: Clean and comfortable. The chipotle salsa is spicy and tasty. My burrito was good, but I didn't like what I ordered. I ordered the Azteca burrito with marinated pork. There was a taste of cinnamon to it that I didn't like; I'm not sure if that was the "Azteca" or the "marinated pork". I should have stuck with my old fave carnitas.
author: Rob T.

description: The food here is solidly good--not earth-shattering, but very good, especially considering the good price. The chips were warm and crunchy, the staff was nice, and the place was clean.
author: Ramon E.

description:
Not bad for Mexican food in the Sunset, really. Definitely better than La Avenida (not hard) and often better than Gordo's. Although Gordo's quesadillas are MUCH MUCH better than La Fonda's. In fact, do NOT order La Fonda's quesadillas. Cheese never quite melted all the way through and tortillas not grilled long enough.  

Carnitas are actually quite good too, not too dry or fatty. I even tried the very un-Mexican "wet" style burrito (Azteca?) with enchilada sauce.  Sauce was okay but a bit too sweet for my taste but again pretty decent size for the price.  Doesn't hurt if you use one of the "buy one get one free burrito" coupons that come in ValuPak coupon package. 

Pluses:
Food seems fresher than Gordo's on Ninth Avenue.  

Larger portions than Gordo's.

More choices on the  menu (not just burritos and tacos) than the other local Mexican taquerias.

Breakfast burritos available.

Minuses:
Service can be hit or miss. You HAVE to watch your order being prepared because they often get it wrong...even the simplest of orders. And god help you if you call your order in...you're liable to get a cheeseburger instead of the burrito you ordered.

Cashiers not always the friendliest...esp. the women..not sure why.
author: rosie t.

description: Pretty good, I have had better. I like the location but other than that it is just an irving streamlined version of a real taco shop.
author: Ryan O.

description: I didn't think nor-cal's non-tex-mex tipo de burritos could be so darn savory. I sit upstairs with my ole homie matty p when I visit the bay and wharf down the best breakfast burrito's you could ever imagine possible. You'll get so full that you'll forget your hangover from the night before at gnancy's.
author: Brian M.

description: The interior was nice. The food was not. Yet another reason for me to stay on my block and eat Gordos, and for that I am sad.
author: James J.

description: I like going here with friends for drinks and getting a few side dishes with the drinks.  Their guacamole is fresh and yummy.  They have a tasty choco cake, a great ceviche, and these little quesadillas in a crunchy empanada casing.  My meat eating friends like the skirt steak and the lamb.  I like the shrimp and chicken tamale.  Finally, they have a great deal on flights of tequilla and rum so if you're in the mood for some hard a, go there!
author: Annie F.

description:
Absolutely Love this Place!

There food is authentic and delicious! What more could you ask for.  When I say authentic, it means it is not greasy or piled with cheese, cream or anything else that ruins great flavor (unless of course that is what you want then they will add it).The service is quick and great, they are all so sweet and friendly.
Love th chips and the salsa bar, definitely some the best !
author: Lissi A.

description: I used to eat at Gordos all the time not knowing La Fonda was right around the corner.  For me, it's hard to Fuck up a burrito, but once I saw La Fonda and ate there, I knew Gordos had been doing just that.  After eating a gazillion burritos at countless Mexican places over the last fifteen years, I can say that La Fondas rad as hell... and cheap too.  I can bust out of there with a belly full of veggie burrito for under five bucks.  Five stars.
author: David V.

description: Best mexican in inner sunset. I should qualify that by saying my pronouncement comes  solely from the super burrito al pastor. Gordo's and l'Avenida were not as good as La Fonda which beat them by far in the al pastor super burrito category.
author: Snora E.

description: Not completely foul, but if you want nothing more than a delicious burrito... this isn't the place. I wasn't a fan.
author: Alexis T.

description: The employees are really nice. Decent meals. Serving size is a little too big. The meat is no good.
author: Al A.

description: Pretty standard slightly upscale burrito.  It costs $7-8.  There's Gordo's right around the corner, but I'm not feeling Gordo's, never have.  So there you have it.
author: Martine D.

description: i hate gordo's and am suspicious of l'avenida due to yelp reviews, but ventured into la fonda after reading emily's review.  mmmm, am i glad that i did!!  the sunset does have passable mexican after all!!  first of all, their chips were some of the best i've ever had.  also, their super veggie burrito was really fresh, big, cheap, and good.  i'm definitely coming back here (maybe for dinner tonight :) ).
author: Roshni R.

description: So, I've had their burritos and their tamale dinners. Not a fan of hte burritos, kinda bland. The tamales, however, were really good! Now, I do want to mention to the foodies out there that they do microwave already refirgerated tamales, but from how long tamales take to make from my understanding, I don't blame them. The microwaving didn't seem to detract from the flavor at all and there were no hot and cold patches. The portions were huge with 2 tamales, full helping of rice and beans and a small salad. Yum!
author: Jennifer D.

description: this place is very nice.  i have a friend who lives in the neighborhood, and this has become a part of our regular dining rotation.  i particularly like their corn tortillas, which are thick and fresh, with a hint of a smoky flavor.  the menu strikes a good balance between heavy and non-heavy items.  the burritos have a nice heft to them, while the tacos are light and tender.  the nachos are covered in gooey beans and cheese, while the aguas frescas are light and not too sweet (jamaica is my favorite of their flavors!).  prices are a little higher than in the mission, but it's still a cheap dinner in this neighborhood.  i also like that they heat everything on the griddle instead of the steam table.
author: emmie k.

description: Ahhhhhh yummmmy cheap vegetarian Mexican food... what more can I ask?  Oh, I know... how about NOT charging me for the sour cream that I ask for on the side?!!  Aside from this minor gripe, I have nothing negative to say about this cute little authentic-looking Mexi place so close to my house.  Clean and colorful interior (with high ceilings so you don't go out smelling like Taco Bell, THANK GOD!) and quick friendly service, and the food... well the tofu taco that I ordered was very delicious, with the tofu being just the right texture (very firm) and perfectly seasoned without being too salty.  And the black beans were scrumptious as well.  So yes, a simple but wonderfully delicious $2.20 taco is going to entice me to come back to this place, in spite of the stinginess with the sour cream.  My next target will be trying their "Tofu Ranchero" burrito... should be interesting.  Also, I'm sure the restaurant owners did not intend this when they named their business, but I can't help but crack up every time I'm reminded of how much this restaurant almost shares the same name as a Napoleon Dynamite character. LOL
author: Catherine C.

description: Great food, great prices, great spot. Their tofu ranchero burritos are so good!
author: Maximilian M.

description: as I was walking to gordo's, I passed la fonda and realized I'd never given it a try.  a good friend of mine recommended it a while back, so I figured why not.  their menu is big and offers a lot of different things you can't get at most taquerias, and they have a little salsa bar which is always fun.  my super chicken burrito was sooo disappointing!  it was made so small that the tortilla was rolled in itself, resulting in a big glob of tortilla in every bite.  the proportions of the fillings were insane: 80% chicken, overpowering the flavors of everything else; in fact I can't even remember tasting guacamole.  maybe one day I'll go back and try different things on the menu.  but as far as a take-out burrito from the sunset goes, I'll stick to gordo's.
author: Jen P.

description: i tried the spicy/ tinga chicken burrito, it's kinda bland. i like the chip, and salsa has distinct roasted flavor. the place is quiet small but nice and clean, that's one point. i found that burrito at burrito express in outer sunset are tastier (but i don't like the place).
author: Suki S.

description: I've tried them 3 times now, but I keep coming to the same conclusion: They are really, really, really bad.  If you own El Farolito and you are reading this, please open up a store in the inner sunset.
author: Brandyn B.

description: went here last night with a couple of girlfriends. we were no less than wasted, but I thought this place was pretty darn good, intoxication aside. we ordered two tacos, an empanada and nachos. total was $18 I think, which is pretty good. I ate the empanada and it was tasty. grilled poblano peppers with some sort of cheese. nachos were plentiful and covered in guacamole. I can't wait to come back when whiskey isn't coming out of my pores and I don't have such bad munchies. that will be the ultimate test.
author: Cathleen M.

description: this is a chron pick, and after two picks, delete.  nicely redone spot with alot of up but the food and service will have the out of business sign sooner than later ... hard working staff but lack of coordination, ordered special, staff:  what is the special? helpful, real nice, butt, lack of confidence shows ... food arrived in timely manner, but cold ...  next time i come here i will order burrito from gordo, buy beverage from fonda and utilize their cozy upstairs hide-away for secret rendevouzs ...
author: tim y.

description: there are 2 better burrito places within a block.  Even when ordered spicy, the heat is lacking.
author: Klite A.

description: I am so fond of La Fonda that Chipotle has some serious competition for my $$$. Burritos are good sized (meaning large), fresh and of course filling
author: Che G.

description: i took my friend out here last night for her 26th birthday! woo! and for the most part we had a good time. the food was affordable, the atmosphere was pretty nice for a taqueria, and our steak quesadilla was damn good! we also got a chicken burrito which i think was okay but could have been made better just by heating it up a little. i would definitely go there again, but this time i think i'll try something meatless and have them heat my burrito up a bit. overall if you like tasty, fast, and inexpensive, this is the place to go!
author: Melissa A.

description: nice  selection of  tasty eats...    it has become my favorite   'food log'  stop, since the other local fav  has  not been doing it for me since it under went changes.
author: dan s.

description: To sum this place up I would say this joint is always consistent when it comes to great service and their bomb burritos which are always on the grande side and loaded with fresh veggies...yumm:)  Oh yeah did I forget to mention this place does NOT break your bank account.
author: Kellie R.

description: they have some of the best spicy chicken burritos that you can get...it is definitely their best one!! they make a perfect size burrito and they are always friendly!!
author: J C.

description: pretty good burritos and always a deal when you bring in a valpak coupon! buy one get one free, how could you go wrong?!
author: Lisa M.
